40#include <netinet/sctp_os.h>
41#include <netinet/sctp_var.h>
42#include <netinet/sctp_sysctl.h>
43#include <netinet/sctp_pcb.h>
44#include <netinet/sctp_header.h>
45#include <netinet/sctputil.h>
46#include <netinet/sctp_output.h>
47#include <netinet/sctp_asconf.h>
48#include <netinet/sctp_timer.h>
49
50/*
51 * debug flags:
52 * SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1: protocol info, general info and errors
53 * SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF2: detailed info
54 */
55
56/*
57 * RFC 5061
58 *
59 * An ASCONF parameter queue exists per asoc which holds the pending address
60 * operations. Lists are updated upon receipt of ASCONF-ACK.
61 *
62 * A restricted_addrs list exists per assoc to hold local addresses that are
63 * not (yet) usable by the assoc as a source address. These addresses are
64 * either pending an ASCONF operation (and exist on the ASCONF parameter
65 * queue), or they are permanently restricted (the peer has returned an
66 * ERROR indication to an ASCONF(ADD), or the peer does not support ASCONF).
67 *
68 * Deleted addresses are always immediately removed from the lists as they will
69 * (shortly) no longer exist in the kernel. We send ASCONFs as a courtesy,
70 * only if allowed.
71 */
72
73/*
74 * ASCONF parameter processing.
75 * response_required: set if a reply is required (eg. SUCCESS_REPORT).
76 * returns a mbuf to an "error" response parameter or NULL/"success" if ok.
77 * FIX: allocating this many mbufs on the fly is pretty inefficient...
78 */
79static struct mbuf *
80sctp_asconf_success_response(uint32_t id)
81{
82 struct mbuf *m_reply = NULL;
83 struct sctp_asconf_paramhdr *aph;
84
85 m_reply = sctp_get_mbuf_for_msg(sizeof(struct sctp_asconf_paramhdr),
86 0, M_NOWAIT, 1, MT_DATA);
87 if (m_reply == NULL) {
88 SCTPDBG(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1,
89 "asconf_success_response: couldn't get mbuf!\n");
90 return (NULL);
91 }
92 aph = mtod(m_reply, struct sctp_asconf_paramhdr *);
93 aph->correlation_id = id;
94 aph->ph.param_type = htons(SCTP_SUCCESS_REPORT);
95 aph->ph.param_length = sizeof(struct sctp_asconf_paramhdr);
96 SCTP_BUF_LEN(m_reply) = aph->ph.param_length;
97 aph->ph.param_length = htons(aph->ph.param_length);
98
99 return (m_reply);
100}
101
102static struct mbuf *
103sctp_asconf_error_response(uint32_t id, uint16_t cause, uint8_t *error_tlv,
104 uint16_t tlv_length)
105{
106 struct mbuf *m_reply = NULL;
107 struct sctp_asconf_paramhdr *aph;
108 struct sctp_error_cause *error;
109 uint32_t buf_len;
110 uint16_t i, param_length, cause_length, padding_length;
111 uint8_t *tlv;
112
113 if (error_tlv == NULL) {
114 tlv_length = 0;
115 }
116 cause_length = sizeof(struct sctp_error_cause) + tlv_length;
117 param_length = sizeof(struct sctp_asconf_paramhdr) + cause_length;
118 padding_length = tlv_length % 4;
119 if (padding_length != 0) {
120 padding_length = 4 - padding_length;
121 }
122 buf_len = param_length + padding_length;
123 if (buf_len > MLEN) {
124 SCTPDBG(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1,
125 "asconf_error_response: tlv_length (%xh) too big\n",
126 tlv_length);
127 return (NULL);
128 }
129 m_reply = sctp_get_mbuf_for_msg(buf_len, 0, M_NOWAIT, 1, MT_DATA);
130 if (m_reply == NULL) {
131 SCTPDBG(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1,
132 "asconf_error_response: couldn't get mbuf!\n");
133 return (NULL);
134 }
135 aph = mtod(m_reply, struct sctp_asconf_paramhdr *);
136 aph->ph.param_type = htons(SCTP_ERROR_CAUSE_IND);
137 aph->ph.param_length = htons(param_length);
138 aph->correlation_id = id;
139 error = (struct sctp_error_cause *)(aph + 1);
140 error->code = htons(cause);
141 error->length = htons(cause_length);
142 if (error_tlv != NULL) {
143 tlv = (uint8_t *) (error + 1);
144 memcpy(tlv, error_tlv, tlv_length);
145 for (i = 0; i < padding_length; i++) {
146 tlv[tlv_length + i] = 0;
147 }
148 }
149 SCTP_BUF_LEN(m_reply) = buf_len;
150 return (m_reply);
151}
152
153static struct mbuf *
154sctp_process_asconf_add_ip(struct sockaddr *src, struct sctp_asconf_paramhdr *aph,
155 struct sctp_tcb *stcb, int send_hb, int response_required)
156{
157 struct sctp_nets *net;
158 struct mbuf *m_reply = NULL;
159 union sctp_sockstore store;
160 struct sctp_paramhdr *ph;
161 uint16_t param_type, aparam_length;
162#if defined(INET) || defined(INET6)
163 uint16_t param_length;
164#endif
165 struct sockaddr *sa;
166 int zero_address = 0;
167 int bad_address = 0;
168#ifdef INET
169 struct sockaddr_in *sin;
170 struct sctp_ipv4addr_param *v4addr;
171#endif
172#ifdef INET6
173 struct sockaddr_in6 *sin6;
174 struct sctp_ipv6addr_param *v6addr;
175#endif
176
177 aparam_length = ntohs(aph->ph.param_length);
178 if (aparam_length < sizeof(struct sctp_asconf_paramhdr) + sizeof(struct sctp_paramhdr)) {
179 return (NULL);
180 }
181 ph = (struct sctp_paramhdr *)(aph + 1);
182 param_type = ntohs(ph->param_type);
183#if defined(INET) || defined(INET6)
184 param_length = ntohs(ph->param_length);
185 if (param_length + sizeof(struct sctp_asconf_paramhdr) != aparam_length) {
186 return (NULL);
187 }
188#endif
189 sa = &store.sa;
190 switch (param_type) {
191#ifdef INET
192 case SCTP_IPV4_ADDRESS:
193 if (param_length != sizeof(struct sctp_ipv4addr_param)) {
194 /* invalid param size */
195 return (NULL);
196 }
197 v4addr = (struct sctp_ipv4addr_param *)ph;
198 sin = &store.sin;
199 memset(sin, 0, sizeof(*sin));
200 sin->sin_family = AF_INET;
201#ifdef HAVE_SIN_LEN
202 sin->sin_len = sizeof(struct sockaddr_in);
203#endif
204 sin->sin_port = stcb->rport;
205 sin->sin_addr.s_addr = v4addr->addr;
206 if ((sin->sin_addr.s_addr == INADDR_BROADCAST) ||
207 IN_MULTICAST(ntohl(sin->sin_addr.s_addr))) {
208 bad_address = 1;
209 }
210 if (sin->sin_addr.s_addr == INADDR_ANY)
211 zero_address = 1;
212 SCTPDBG(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1, "process_asconf_add_ip: adding ");
213 SCTPDBG_ADDR(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1, sa);
214 break;
215#endif
216#ifdef INET6
217 case SCTP_IPV6_ADDRESS:
218 if (param_length != sizeof(struct sctp_ipv6addr_param)) {
219 /* invalid param size */
220 return (NULL);
221 }
222 v6addr = (struct sctp_ipv6addr_param *)ph;
223 sin6 = &store.sin6;
224 memset(sin6, 0, sizeof(*sin6));
225 sin6->sin6_family = AF_INET6;
226#ifdef HAVE_SIN6_LEN
227 sin6->sin6_len = sizeof(struct sockaddr_in6);
228#endif
229 sin6->sin6_port = stcb->rport;
230 memcpy((caddr_t)&sin6->sin6_addr, v6addr->addr,
231 sizeof(struct in6_addr));
232 if (IN6_IS_ADDR_MULTICAST(&sin6->sin6_addr)) {
233 bad_address = 1;
234 }
235 if (IN6_IS_ADDR_UNSPECIFIED(&sin6->sin6_addr))
236 zero_address = 1;
237 SCTPDBG(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1, "process_asconf_add_ip: adding ");
238 SCTPDBG_ADDR(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1, sa);
239 break;
240#endif
241 default:
242 m_reply = sctp_asconf_error_response(aph->correlation_id,
243 SCTP_CAUSE_INVALID_PARAM, (uint8_t *) aph,
244 aparam_length);
245 return (m_reply);
246 } /* end switch */
247
248 /* if 0.0.0.0/::0, add the source address instead */
249 if (zero_address && SCTP_BASE_SYSCTL(sctp_nat_friendly)) {
250 sa = src;
251 SCTPDBG(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1,
252 "process_asconf_add_ip: using source addr ");
253 SCTPDBG_ADDR(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1, src);
254 }
255 net = NULL;
256 /* add the address */
257 if (bad_address) {
258 m_reply = sctp_asconf_error_response(aph->correlation_id,
259 SCTP_CAUSE_INVALID_PARAM, (uint8_t *) aph,
260 aparam_length);
261 } else if (sctp_add_remote_addr(stcb, sa, &net, stcb->asoc.port,
262 SCTP_DONOT_SETSCOPE,
263 SCTP_ADDR_DYNAMIC_ADDED) != 0) {
264 SCTPDBG(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1,
265 "process_asconf_add_ip: error adding address\n");
266 m_reply = sctp_asconf_error_response(aph->correlation_id,
267 SCTP_CAUSE_RESOURCE_SHORTAGE, (uint8_t *) aph,
268 aparam_length);
269 } else {
270 if (response_required) {
271 m_reply =
272 sctp_asconf_success_response(aph->correlation_id);
273 }
274 if (net != NULL) {
275 /* notify upper layer */
276 sctp_ulp_notify(SCTP_NOTIFY_ASCONF_ADD_IP, stcb, 0, sa, SCTP_SO_NOT_LOCKED);
277 sctp_timer_start(SCTP_TIMER_TYPE_PATHMTURAISE, stcb->sctp_ep, stcb, net);
278 sctp_timer_start(SCTP_TIMER_TYPE_HEARTBEAT, stcb->sctp_ep,
279 stcb, net);
280 if (send_hb) {
281 sctp_send_hb(stcb, net, SCTP_SO_NOT_LOCKED);
282 }
283 }
284 }
285 return (m_reply);
286}
287
288static int
289sctp_asconf_del_remote_addrs_except(struct sctp_tcb *stcb, struct sockaddr *src)
290{
291 struct sctp_nets *src_net, *net, *nnet;
292
293 /* make sure the source address exists as a destination net */
294 src_net = sctp_findnet(stcb, src);
295 if (src_net == NULL) {
296 /* not found */
297 return (-1);
298 }
299
300 /* delete all destination addresses except the source */
301 TAILQ_FOREACH_SAFE(net, &stcb->asoc.nets, sctp_next, nnet) {
302 if (net != src_net) {
303 /* delete this address */
304 SCTPDBG(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1,
305 "asconf_del_remote_addrs_except: deleting ");
306 SCTPDBG_ADDR(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1,
307 (struct sockaddr *)&net->ro._l_addr);
308 /* notify upper layer */
309 sctp_ulp_notify(SCTP_NOTIFY_ASCONF_DELETE_IP, stcb, 0,
310 (struct sockaddr *)&net->ro._l_addr, SCTP_SO_NOT_LOCKED);
311 sctp_remove_net(stcb, net);
312 }
313 }
314 return (0);
315}
316
317static struct mbuf *
318sctp_process_asconf_delete_ip(struct sockaddr *src,
319 struct sctp_asconf_paramhdr *aph,
320 struct sctp_tcb *stcb, int response_required)
321{
322 struct mbuf *m_reply = NULL;
323 union sctp_sockstore store;
324 struct sctp_paramhdr *ph;
325 uint16_t param_type, aparam_length;
326#if defined(INET) || defined(INET6)
327 uint16_t param_length;
328#endif
329 struct sockaddr *sa;
330 int zero_address = 0;
331 int result;
332#ifdef INET
333 struct sockaddr_in *sin;
334 struct sctp_ipv4addr_param *v4addr;
335#endif
336#ifdef INET6
337 struct sockaddr_in6 *sin6;
338 struct sctp_ipv6addr_param *v6addr;
339#endif
340
341 aparam_length = ntohs(aph->ph.param_length);
342 if (aparam_length < sizeof(struct sctp_asconf_paramhdr) + sizeof(struct sctp_paramhdr)) {
343 return (NULL);
344 }
345 ph = (struct sctp_paramhdr *)(aph + 1);
346 param_type = ntohs(ph->param_type);
347#if defined(INET) || defined(INET6)
348 param_length = ntohs(ph->param_length);
349 if (param_length + sizeof(struct sctp_asconf_paramhdr) != aparam_length) {
350 return (NULL);
351 }
352#endif
353 sa = &store.sa;
354 switch (param_type) {
355#ifdef INET
356 case SCTP_IPV4_ADDRESS:
357 if (param_length != sizeof(struct sctp_ipv4addr_param)) {
358 /* invalid param size */
359 return (NULL);
360 }
361 v4addr = (struct sctp_ipv4addr_param *)ph;
362 sin = &store.sin;
363 memset(sin, 0, sizeof(*sin));
364 sin->sin_family = AF_INET;
365#ifdef HAVE_SIN_LEN
366 sin->sin_len = sizeof(struct sockaddr_in);
367#endif
368 sin->sin_port = stcb->rport;
369 sin->sin_addr.s_addr = v4addr->addr;
370 if (sin->sin_addr.s_addr == INADDR_ANY)
371 zero_address = 1;
372 SCTPDBG(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1,
373 "process_asconf_delete_ip: deleting ");
374 SCTPDBG_ADDR(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1, sa);
375 break;
376#endif
377#ifdef INET6
378 case SCTP_IPV6_ADDRESS:
379 if (param_length != sizeof(struct sctp_ipv6addr_param)) {
380 /* invalid param size */
381 return (NULL);
382 }
383 v6addr = (struct sctp_ipv6addr_param *)ph;
384 sin6 = &store.sin6;
385 memset(sin6, 0, sizeof(*sin6));
386 sin6->sin6_family = AF_INET6;
387#ifdef HAVE_SIN6_LEN
388 sin6->sin6_len = sizeof(struct sockaddr_in6);
389#endif
390 sin6->sin6_port = stcb->rport;
391 memcpy(&sin6->sin6_addr, v6addr->addr,
392 sizeof(struct in6_addr));
393 if (IN6_IS_ADDR_UNSPECIFIED(&sin6->sin6_addr))
394 zero_address = 1;
395 SCTPDBG(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1,
396 "process_asconf_delete_ip: deleting ");
397 SCTPDBG_ADDR(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1, sa);
398 break;
399#endif
400 default:
401 m_reply = sctp_asconf_error_response(aph->correlation_id,
402 SCTP_CAUSE_UNRESOLVABLE_ADDR, (uint8_t *) aph,
403 aparam_length);
404 return (m_reply);
405 }
406
407 /* make sure the source address is not being deleted */
408 if (sctp_cmpaddr(sa, src)) {
409 /* trying to delete the source address! */
410 SCTPDBG(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1, "process_asconf_delete_ip: tried to delete source addr\n");
411 m_reply = sctp_asconf_error_response(aph->correlation_id,
412 SCTP_CAUSE_DELETING_SRC_ADDR, (uint8_t *) aph,
413 aparam_length);
414 return (m_reply);
415 }
416
417 /* if deleting 0.0.0.0/::0, delete all addresses except src addr */
418 if (zero_address && SCTP_BASE_SYSCTL(sctp_nat_friendly)) {
419 result = sctp_asconf_del_remote_addrs_except(stcb, src);
420
421 if (result) {
422 /* src address did not exist? */
423 SCTPDBG(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1, "process_asconf_delete_ip: src addr does not exist?\n");
424 /* what error to reply with?? */
425 m_reply =
426 sctp_asconf_error_response(aph->correlation_id,
427 SCTP_CAUSE_REQUEST_REFUSED, (uint8_t *) aph,
428 aparam_length);
429 } else if (response_required) {
430 m_reply =
431 sctp_asconf_success_response(aph->correlation_id);
432 }
433 return (m_reply);
434 }
435
436 /* delete the address */
437 result = sctp_del_remote_addr(stcb, sa);
438 /*
439 * note if result == -2, the address doesn't exist in the asoc but
440 * since it's being deleted anyways, we just ack the delete -- but
441 * this probably means something has already gone awry
442 */
443 if (result == -1) {
444 /* only one address in the asoc */
445 SCTPDBG(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1, "process_asconf_delete_ip: tried to delete last IP addr!\n");
446 m_reply = sctp_asconf_error_response(aph->correlation_id,
447 SCTP_CAUSE_DELETING_LAST_ADDR, (uint8_t *) aph,
448 aparam_length);
449 } else {
450 if (response_required) {
451 m_reply = sctp_asconf_success_response(aph->correlation_id);
452 }
453 /* notify upper layer */
454 sctp_ulp_notify(SCTP_NOTIFY_ASCONF_DELETE_IP, stcb, 0, sa, SCTP_SO_NOT_LOCKED);
455 }
456 return (m_reply);
457}
458
459static struct mbuf *
460sctp_process_asconf_set_primary(struct sockaddr *src,
461 struct sctp_asconf_paramhdr *aph,
462 struct sctp_tcb *stcb, int response_required)
463{
464 struct mbuf *m_reply = NULL;
465 union sctp_sockstore store;
466 struct sctp_paramhdr *ph;
467 uint16_t param_type, aparam_length;
468#if defined(INET) || defined(INET6)
469 uint16_t param_length;
470#endif
471 struct sockaddr *sa;
472 int zero_address = 0;
473#ifdef INET
474 struct sockaddr_in *sin;
475 struct sctp_ipv4addr_param *v4addr;
476#endif
477#ifdef INET6
478 struct sockaddr_in6 *sin6;
479 struct sctp_ipv6addr_param *v6addr;
480#endif
481
482 aparam_length = ntohs(aph->ph.param_length);
483 if (aparam_length < sizeof(struct sctp_asconf_paramhdr) + sizeof(struct sctp_paramhdr)) {
484 return (NULL);
485 }
486 ph = (struct sctp_paramhdr *)(aph + 1);
487 param_type = ntohs(ph->param_type);
488#if defined(INET) || defined(INET6)
489 param_length = ntohs(ph->param_length);
490 if (param_length + sizeof(struct sctp_asconf_paramhdr) != aparam_length) {
491 return (NULL);
492 }
493#endif
494 sa = &store.sa;
495 switch (param_type) {
496#ifdef INET
497 case SCTP_IPV4_ADDRESS:
498 if (param_length != sizeof(struct sctp_ipv4addr_param)) {
499 /* invalid param size */
500 return (NULL);
501 }
502 v4addr = (struct sctp_ipv4addr_param *)ph;
503 sin = &store.sin;
504 memset(sin, 0, sizeof(*sin));
505 sin->sin_family = AF_INET;
506#ifdef HAVE_SIN_LEN
507 sin->sin_len = sizeof(struct sockaddr_in);
508#endif
509 sin->sin_addr.s_addr = v4addr->addr;
510 if (sin->sin_addr.s_addr == INADDR_ANY)
511 zero_address = 1;
512 SCTPDBG(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1, "process_asconf_set_primary: ");
513 SCTPDBG_ADDR(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1, sa);
514 break;
515#endif
516#ifdef INET6
517 case SCTP_IPV6_ADDRESS:
518 if (param_length != sizeof(struct sctp_ipv6addr_param)) {
519 /* invalid param size */
520 return (NULL);
521 }
522 v6addr = (struct sctp_ipv6addr_param *)ph;
523 sin6 = &store.sin6;
524 memset(sin6, 0, sizeof(*sin6));
525 sin6->sin6_family = AF_INET6;
526#ifdef HAVE_SIN6_LEN
527 sin6->sin6_len = sizeof(struct sockaddr_in6);
528#endif
529 memcpy((caddr_t)&sin6->sin6_addr, v6addr->addr,
530 sizeof(struct in6_addr));
531 if (IN6_IS_ADDR_UNSPECIFIED(&sin6->sin6_addr))
532 zero_address = 1;
533 SCTPDBG(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1, "process_asconf_set_primary: ");
534 SCTPDBG_ADDR(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1, sa);
535 break;
536#endif
537 default:
538 m_reply = sctp_asconf_error_response(aph->correlation_id,
539 SCTP_CAUSE_UNRESOLVABLE_ADDR, (uint8_t *) aph,
540 aparam_length);
541 return (m_reply);
542 }
543
544 /* if 0.0.0.0/::0, use the source address instead */
545 if (zero_address && SCTP_BASE_SYSCTL(sctp_nat_friendly)) {
546 sa = src;
547 SCTPDBG(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1,
548 "process_asconf_set_primary: using source addr ");
549 SCTPDBG_ADDR(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1, src);
550 }
551 /* set the primary address */
552 if (sctp_set_primary_addr(stcb, sa, NULL) == 0) {
553 SCTPDBG(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1,
554 "process_asconf_set_primary: primary address set\n");
555 /* notify upper layer */
556 sctp_ulp_notify(SCTP_NOTIFY_ASCONF_SET_PRIMARY, stcb, 0, sa, SCTP_SO_NOT_LOCKED);
557 if ((stcb->asoc.primary_destination->dest_state & SCTP_ADDR_REACHABLE) &&
558 (!(stcb->asoc.primary_destination->dest_state & SCTP_ADDR_PF)) &&
559 (stcb->asoc.alternate)) {
560 sctp_free_remote_addr(stcb->asoc.alternate);
561 stcb->asoc.alternate = NULL;
562 }
563 if (response_required) {
564 m_reply = sctp_asconf_success_response(aph->correlation_id);
565 }
566 /* Mobility adaptation.
567 Ideally, when the reception of SET PRIMARY with DELETE IP
568 ADDRESS of the previous primary destination, unacknowledged
569 DATA are retransmitted immediately to the new primary
570 destination for seamless handover.
571 If the destination is UNCONFIRMED and marked to REQ_PRIM,
572 The retransmission occur when reception of the
573 HEARTBEAT-ACK. (See sctp_handle_heartbeat_ack in
574 sctp_input.c)
575 Also, when change of the primary destination, it is better
576 that all subsequent new DATA containing already queued DATA
577 are transmitted to the new primary destination. (by micchie)
578 */
579 if ((sctp_is_mobility_feature_on(stcb->sctp_ep,
580 SCTP_MOBILITY_BASE) ||
581 sctp_is_mobility_feature_on(stcb->sctp_ep,
582 SCTP_MOBILITY_FASTHANDOFF)) &&
583 sctp_is_mobility_feature_on(stcb->sctp_ep,
584 SCTP_MOBILITY_PRIM_DELETED) &&
585 (stcb->asoc.primary_destination->dest_state &
586 SCTP_ADDR_UNCONFIRMED) == 0) {
587 sctp_timer_stop(SCTP_TIMER_TYPE_PRIM_DELETED,
588 stcb->sctp_ep, stcb, NULL,
589 SCTP_FROM_SCTP_ASCONF + SCTP_LOC_1);
590 if (sctp_is_mobility_feature_on(stcb->sctp_ep,
591 SCTP_MOBILITY_FASTHANDOFF)) {
592 sctp_assoc_immediate_retrans(stcb,
593 stcb->asoc.primary_destination);
594 }
595 if (sctp_is_mobility_feature_on(stcb->sctp_ep,
596 SCTP_MOBILITY_BASE)) {
597 sctp_move_chunks_from_net(stcb,
598 stcb->asoc.deleted_primary);
599 }
600 sctp_delete_prim_timer(stcb->sctp_ep, stcb);
601 }
602 } else {
603 /* couldn't set the requested primary address! */
604 SCTPDBG(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1,
605 "process_asconf_set_primary: set primary failed!\n");
606 /* must have been an invalid address, so report */
607 m_reply = sctp_asconf_error_response(aph->correlation_id,
608 SCTP_CAUSE_UNRESOLVABLE_ADDR, (uint8_t *) aph,
609 aparam_length);
610 }
611
612 return (m_reply);
613}
614
615/*
616 * handles an ASCONF chunk.
617 * if all parameters are processed ok, send a plain (empty) ASCONF-ACK
618 */
619void
620sctp_handle_asconf(struct mbuf *m, unsigned int offset,
621 struct sockaddr *src,
622 struct sctp_asconf_chunk *cp, struct sctp_tcb *stcb,
623 int first)
624{
625 struct sctp_association *asoc;
626 uint32_t serial_num;
627 struct mbuf *n, *m_ack, *m_result, *m_tail;
628 struct sctp_asconf_ack_chunk *ack_cp;
629 struct sctp_asconf_paramhdr *aph;
630 struct sctp_ipv6addr_param *p_addr;
631 unsigned int asconf_limit, cnt;
632 int error = 0; /* did an error occur? */
633
634 /* asconf param buffer */
635 uint8_t aparam_buf[SCTP_PARAM_BUFFER_SIZE];
636 struct sctp_asconf_ack *ack, *ack_next;
637
638 /* verify minimum length */
639 if (ntohs(cp->ch.chunk_length) < sizeof(struct sctp_asconf_chunk)) {
640 SCTPDBG(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1,
641 "handle_asconf: chunk too small = %xh\n",
642 ntohs(cp->ch.chunk_length));
643 return;
644 }
645 asoc = &stcb->asoc;
646 serial_num = ntohl(cp->serial_number);
647
648 if (SCTP_TSN_GE(asoc->asconf_seq_in, serial_num)) {
649 /* got a duplicate ASCONF */
650 SCTPDBG(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1,
651 "handle_asconf: got duplicate serial number = %xh\n",
652 serial_num);
653 return;
654 } else if (serial_num != (asoc->asconf_seq_in + 1)) {
655 SCTPDBG(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1, "handle_asconf: incorrect serial number = %xh (expected next = %xh)\n",
656 serial_num, asoc->asconf_seq_in + 1);
657 return;
658 }
659
660 /* it's the expected "next" sequence number, so process it */
661 asoc->asconf_seq_in = serial_num; /* update sequence */
662 /* get length of all the param's in the ASCONF */
663 asconf_limit = offset + ntohs(cp->ch.chunk_length);
664 SCTPDBG(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1,
665 "handle_asconf: asconf_limit=%u, sequence=%xh\n",
666 asconf_limit, serial_num);
667
668 if (first) {
669 /* delete old cache */
670 SCTPDBG(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1,"handle_asconf: Now processing first ASCONF. Try to delete old cache\n");
671
672 TAILQ_FOREACH_SAFE(ack, &asoc->asconf_ack_sent, next, ack_next) {
673 if (ack->serial_number == serial_num)
674 break;
675 SCTPDBG(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1,"handle_asconf: delete old(%u) < first(%u)\n",
676 ack->serial_number, serial_num);
677 TAILQ_REMOVE(&asoc->asconf_ack_sent, ack, next);
678 if (ack->data != NULL) {
679 sctp_m_freem(ack->data);
680 }
681 SCTP_ZONE_FREE(SCTP_BASE_INFO(ipi_zone_asconf_ack), ack);
682 }
683 }
684
685 m_ack = sctp_get_mbuf_for_msg(sizeof(struct sctp_asconf_ack_chunk), 0,
686 M_NOWAIT, 1, MT_DATA);
687 if (m_ack == NULL) {
688 SCTPDBG(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1,
689 "handle_asconf: couldn't get mbuf!\n");
690 return;
691 }
692 m_tail = m_ack; /* current reply chain's tail */
693
694 /* fill in ASCONF-ACK header */
695 ack_cp = mtod(m_ack, struct sctp_asconf_ack_chunk *);
696 ack_cp->ch.chunk_type = SCTP_ASCONF_ACK;
697 ack_cp->ch.chunk_flags = 0;
698 ack_cp->serial_number = htonl(serial_num);
699 /* set initial lengths (eg. just an ASCONF-ACK), ntohx at the end! */
700 SCTP_BUF_LEN(m_ack) = sizeof(struct sctp_asconf_ack_chunk);
701 ack_cp->ch.chunk_length = sizeof(struct sctp_asconf_ack_chunk);
702
703 /* skip the lookup address parameter */
704 offset += sizeof(struct sctp_asconf_chunk);
705 p_addr = (struct sctp_ipv6addr_param *)sctp_m_getptr(m, offset, sizeof(struct sctp_paramhdr), (uint8_t *)&aparam_buf);
706 if (p_addr == NULL) {
707 SCTPDBG(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1,
708 "handle_asconf: couldn't get lookup addr!\n");
709 /* respond with a missing/invalid mandatory parameter error */
710 sctp_m_freem(m_ack);
711 return;
712 }
713 /* skip lookup addr */
714 offset += SCTP_SIZE32(ntohs(p_addr->ph.param_length));
715 /* get pointer to first asconf param in ASCONF */
716 aph = (struct sctp_asconf_paramhdr *)sctp_m_getptr(m, offset, sizeof(struct sctp_asconf_paramhdr), (uint8_t *)&aparam_buf);
717 if (aph == NULL) {
718 SCTPDBG(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1, "Empty ASCONF received?\n");
719 goto send_reply;
720 }
721 /* process through all parameters */
722 cnt = 0;
723 while (aph != NULL) {
724 unsigned int param_length, param_type;
725
726 param_type = ntohs(aph->ph.param_type);
727 param_length = ntohs(aph->ph.param_length);
728 if (offset + param_length > asconf_limit) {
729 /* parameter goes beyond end of chunk! */
730 sctp_m_freem(m_ack);
731 return;
732 }
733 m_result = NULL;
734
735 if (param_length > sizeof(aparam_buf)) {
736 SCTPDBG(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1, "handle_asconf: param length (%u) larger than buffer size!\n", param_length);
737 sctp_m_freem(m_ack);
738 return;
739 }
740 if (param_length < sizeof(struct sctp_asconf_paramhdr)) {
741 SCTPDBG(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1, "handle_asconf: param length (%u) too short\n", param_length);
742 sctp_m_freem(m_ack);
743 return;
744 }
745 /* get the entire parameter */
746 aph = (struct sctp_asconf_paramhdr *)sctp_m_getptr(m, offset, param_length, aparam_buf);
747 if (aph == NULL) {
748 SCTPDBG(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1, "handle_asconf: couldn't get entire param\n");
749 sctp_m_freem(m_ack);
750 return;
751 }
752 switch (param_type) {
753 case SCTP_ADD_IP_ADDRESS:
754 m_result = sctp_process_asconf_add_ip(src, aph, stcb,
755 (cnt < SCTP_BASE_SYSCTL(sctp_hb_maxburst)), error);
756 cnt++;
757 break;
758 case SCTP_DEL_IP_ADDRESS:
759 m_result = sctp_process_asconf_delete_ip(src, aph, stcb,
760 error);
761 break;
762 case SCTP_ERROR_CAUSE_IND:
763 /* not valid in an ASCONF chunk */
764 break;
765 case SCTP_SET_PRIM_ADDR:
766 m_result = sctp_process_asconf_set_primary(src, aph,
767 stcb, error);
768 break;
769 case SCTP_NAT_VTAGS:
770 SCTPDBG(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1, "handle_asconf: sees a NAT VTAG state parameter\n");
771 break;
772 case SCTP_SUCCESS_REPORT:
773 /* not valid in an ASCONF chunk */
774 break;
775 case SCTP_ULP_ADAPTATION:
776 /* FIX */
777 break;
778 default:
779 if ((param_type & 0x8000) == 0) {
780 /* Been told to STOP at this param */
781 asconf_limit = offset;
782 /*
783 * FIX FIX - We need to call
784 * sctp_arethere_unrecognized_parameters()
785 * to get a operr and send it for any
786 * param's with the 0x4000 bit set OR do it
787 * here ourselves... note we still must STOP
788 * if the 0x8000 bit is clear.
789 */
790 }
791 /* unknown/invalid param type */
792 break;
793 } /* switch */
794
795 /* add any (error) result to the reply mbuf chain */
796 if (m_result != NULL) {
797 SCTP_BUF_NEXT(m_tail) = m_result;
798 m_tail = m_result;
799 ack_cp->ch.chunk_length += SCTP_BUF_LEN(m_result);
800 /* set flag to force success reports */
801 error = 1;
802 }
803 offset += SCTP_SIZE32(param_length);
804 /* update remaining ASCONF message length to process */
805 if (offset >= asconf_limit) {
806 /* no more data in the mbuf chain */
807 break;
808 }
809 /* get pointer to next asconf param */
810 aph = (struct sctp_asconf_paramhdr *)sctp_m_getptr(m, offset,
811 sizeof(struct sctp_asconf_paramhdr),
812 (uint8_t *)&aparam_buf);
813 if (aph == NULL) {
814 /* can't get an asconf paramhdr */
815 SCTPDBG(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1, "handle_asconf: can't get asconf param hdr!\n");
816 /* FIX ME - add error here... */
817 }
818 }
819
820 send_reply:
821 ack_cp->ch.chunk_length = htons(ack_cp->ch.chunk_length);
822 /* save the ASCONF-ACK reply */
823 ack = SCTP_ZONE_GET(SCTP_BASE_INFO(ipi_zone_asconf_ack),
824 struct sctp_asconf_ack);
825 if (ack == NULL) {
826 sctp_m_freem(m_ack);
827 return;
828 }
829 ack->serial_number = serial_num;
830 ack->last_sent_to = NULL;
831 ack->data = m_ack;
832 ack->len = 0;
833 for (n = m_ack; n != NULL; n = SCTP_BUF_NEXT(n)) {
834 ack->len += SCTP_BUF_LEN(n);
835 }
836 TAILQ_INSERT_TAIL(&stcb->asoc.asconf_ack_sent, ack, next);
837
838 /* see if last_control_chunk_from is set properly (use IP src addr) */
839 if (stcb->asoc.last_control_chunk_from == NULL) {
840 /*
841 * this could happen if the source address was just newly
842 * added
843 */
844 SCTPDBG(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1, "handle_asconf: looking up net for IP source address\n");
845 SCTPDBG(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1, "Looking for IP source: ");
846 SCTPDBG_ADDR(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1, src);
847 /* look up the from address */
848 stcb->asoc.last_control_chunk_from = sctp_findnet(stcb, src);
849#ifdef SCTP_DEBUG
850 if (stcb->asoc.last_control_chunk_from == NULL) {
851 SCTPDBG(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1, "handle_asconf: IP source address not found?!\n");
852 }
853#endif
854 }
855}
856
857/*
858 * does the address match? returns 0 if not, 1 if so
859 */
860static uint32_t
861sctp_asconf_addr_match(struct sctp_asconf_addr *aa, struct sockaddr *sa)
862{
863 switch (sa->sa_family) {
864#ifdef INET6
865 case AF_INET6:
866 {
867 /* XXX scopeid */
868 struct sockaddr_in6 *sin6 = (struct sockaddr_in6 *)sa;
869
870 if ((aa->ap.addrp.ph.param_type == SCTP_IPV6_ADDRESS) &&
871 (memcmp(&aa->ap.addrp.addr, &sin6->sin6_addr,
872 sizeof(struct in6_addr)) == 0)) {
873 return (1);
874 }
875 break;
876 }
877#endif
878#ifdef INET
879 case AF_INET:
880 {
881 struct sockaddr_in *sin = (struct sockaddr_in *)sa;
882
883 if ((aa->ap.addrp.ph.param_type == SCTP_IPV4_ADDRESS) &&
884 (memcmp(&aa->ap.addrp.addr, &sin->sin_addr,
885 sizeof(struct in_addr)) == 0)) {
886 return (1);
887 }
888 break;
889 }
890#endif
891 default:
892 break;
893 }
894 return (0);
895}
896
897/*
898 * does the address match? returns 0 if not, 1 if so
899 */
900static uint32_t
901sctp_addr_match(struct sctp_paramhdr *ph, struct sockaddr *sa)
902{
903#if defined(INET) || defined(INET6)
904 uint16_t param_type, param_length;
905
906 param_type = ntohs(ph->param_type);
907 param_length = ntohs(ph->param_length);
908#endif
909 switch (sa->sa_family) {
910#ifdef INET6
911 case AF_INET6:
912 {
913 /* XXX scopeid */
914 struct sockaddr_in6 *sin6 = (struct sockaddr_in6 *)sa;
915 struct sctp_ipv6addr_param *v6addr;
916
917 v6addr = (struct sctp_ipv6addr_param *)ph;
918 if ((param_type == SCTP_IPV6_ADDRESS) &&
919 (param_length == sizeof(struct sctp_ipv6addr_param)) &&
920 (memcmp(&v6addr->addr, &sin6->sin6_addr,
921 sizeof(struct in6_addr)) == 0)) {
922 return (1);
923 }
924 break;
925 }
926#endif
927#ifdef INET
928 case AF_INET:
929 {
930 struct sockaddr_in *sin = (struct sockaddr_in *)sa;
931 struct sctp_ipv4addr_param *v4addr;
932
933 v4addr = (struct sctp_ipv4addr_param *)ph;
934 if ((param_type == SCTP_IPV4_ADDRESS) &&
935 (param_length == sizeof(struct sctp_ipv4addr_param)) &&
936 (memcmp(&v4addr->addr, &sin->sin_addr,
937 sizeof(struct in_addr)) == 0)) {
938 return (1);
939 }
940 break;
941 }
942#endif
943 default:
944 break;
945 }
946 return (0);
947}
948/*
949 * Cleanup for non-responded/OP ERR'd ASCONF
950 */
951void
952sctp_asconf_cleanup(struct sctp_tcb *stcb)
953{
954 /*
955 * clear out any existing asconfs going out
956 */
957 sctp_timer_stop(SCTP_TIMER_TYPE_ASCONF, stcb->sctp_ep, stcb, NULL,
958 SCTP_FROM_SCTP_ASCONF + SCTP_LOC_2);
959 stcb->asoc.asconf_seq_out_acked = stcb->asoc.asconf_seq_out;
960 /* remove the old ASCONF on our outbound queue */
961 sctp_toss_old_asconf(stcb);
962}
963
964/*
965 * cleanup any cached source addresses that may be topologically
966 * incorrect after a new address has been added to this interface.
967 */
968static void
969sctp_asconf_nets_cleanup(struct sctp_tcb *stcb, struct sctp_ifn *ifn)
970{
971 struct sctp_nets *net;
972
973 /*
974 * Ideally, we want to only clear cached routes and source addresses
975 * that are topologically incorrect. But since there is no easy way
976 * to know whether the newly added address on the ifn would cause a
977 * routing change (i.e. a new egress interface would be chosen)
978 * without doing a new routing lookup and source address selection,
979 * we will (for now) just flush any cached route using a different
980 * ifn (and cached source addrs) and let output re-choose them during
981 * the next send on that net.
982 */
983 TAILQ_FOREACH(net, &stcb->asoc.nets, sctp_next) {
984 /*
985 * clear any cached route (and cached source address) if the
986 * route's interface is NOT the same as the address change.
987 * If it's the same interface, just clear the cached source
988 * address.
989 */
990 if (SCTP_ROUTE_HAS_VALID_IFN(&net->ro) &&
991 ((ifn == NULL) ||
992 (SCTP_GET_IF_INDEX_FROM_ROUTE(&net->ro) != ifn->ifn_index))) {
993 /* clear any cached route */
994#if defined(__FreeBSD__) && !defined(__Userspace__)
995 RO_NHFREE(&net->ro);
996#else
997 RTFREE(net->ro.ro_rt);
998 net->ro.ro_rt = NULL;
999#endif
1000 }
1001 /* clear any cached source address */
1002 if (net->src_addr_selected) {
1003 sctp_free_ifa(net->ro._s_addr);
1004 net->ro._s_addr = NULL;
1005 net->src_addr_selected = 0;
1006 }
1007 }
1008}
1009
1010void
1011sctp_assoc_immediate_retrans(struct sctp_tcb *stcb, struct sctp_nets *dstnet)
1012{
1013 int error;
1014
1015 if (dstnet->dest_state & SCTP_ADDR_UNCONFIRMED) {
1016 return;
1017 }
1018 if (stcb->asoc.deleted_primary == NULL) {
1019 return;
1020 }
1021
1022 if (!TAILQ_EMPTY(&stcb->asoc.sent_queue)) {
1023 SCTPDBG(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1, "assoc_immediate_retrans: Deleted primary is ");
1024 SCTPDBG_ADDR(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1, &stcb->asoc.deleted_primary->ro._l_addr.sa);
1025 SCTPDBG(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1, "Current Primary is ");
1026 SCTPDBG_ADDR(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1, &stcb->asoc.primary_destination->ro._l_addr.sa);
1027 sctp_timer_stop(SCTP_TIMER_TYPE_SEND, stcb->sctp_ep, stcb,
1028 stcb->asoc.deleted_primary,
1029 SCTP_FROM_SCTP_ASCONF + SCTP_LOC_3);
1030 stcb->asoc.num_send_timers_up--;
1031 if (stcb->asoc.num_send_timers_up < 0) {
1032 stcb->asoc.num_send_timers_up = 0;
1033 }
1034 SCTP_TCB_LOCK_ASSERT(stcb);
1035 error = sctp_t3rxt_timer(stcb->sctp_ep, stcb,
1036 stcb->asoc.deleted_primary);
1037 if (error) {
1038 SCTP_INP_DECR_REF(stcb->sctp_ep);
1039 return;
1040 }
1041 SCTP_TCB_LOCK_ASSERT(stcb);
1042#ifdef SCTP_AUDITING_ENABLED
1043 sctp_auditing(4, stcb->sctp_ep, stcb, stcb->asoc.deleted_primary);
1044#endif
1045 sctp_chunk_output(stcb->sctp_ep, stcb, SCTP_OUTPUT_FROM_T3, SCTP_SO_NOT_LOCKED);
1046 if ((stcb->asoc.num_send_timers_up == 0) &&
1047 (stcb->asoc.sent_queue_cnt > 0)) {
1048 struct sctp_tmit_chunk *chk;
1049
1050 TAILQ_FOREACH(chk, &stcb->asoc.sent_queue, sctp_next) {
1051 if (chk->whoTo != NULL) {
1052 break;
1053 }
1054 }
1055 if (chk != NULL) {
1056 sctp_timer_start(SCTP_TIMER_TYPE_SEND, stcb->sctp_ep, stcb, chk->whoTo);
1057 }
1058 }
1059 }
1060 return;
1061}
1062
1063#if defined(__FreeBSD__) || defined(__APPLE__) || defined(__Userspace__)
1064static int
1065sctp_asconf_queue_mgmt(struct sctp_tcb *, struct sctp_ifa *, uint16_t);
1066
1067void
1068sctp_net_immediate_retrans(struct sctp_tcb *stcb, struct sctp_nets *net)
1069{
1070 struct sctp_tmit_chunk *chk;
1071
1072 SCTPDBG(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1, "net_immediate_retrans: RTO is %d\n", net->RTO);
1073 sctp_timer_stop(SCTP_TIMER_TYPE_SEND, stcb->sctp_ep, stcb, net,
1074 SCTP_FROM_SCTP_ASCONF + SCTP_LOC_4);
1075 stcb->asoc.cc_functions.sctp_set_initial_cc_param(stcb, net);
1076 net->error_count = 0;
1077 TAILQ_FOREACH(chk, &stcb->asoc.sent_queue, sctp_next) {
1078 if (chk->whoTo == net) {
1079 if (chk->sent < SCTP_DATAGRAM_RESEND) {
1080 chk->sent = SCTP_DATAGRAM_RESEND;
1081 sctp_ucount_incr(stcb->asoc.sent_queue_retran_cnt);
1082 sctp_flight_size_decrease(chk);
1083 sctp_total_flight_decrease(stcb, chk);
1084 net->marked_retrans++;
1085 stcb->asoc.marked_retrans++;
1086 }
1087 }
1088 }
1089 if (net->marked_retrans) {
1090 sctp_chunk_output(stcb->sctp_ep, stcb, SCTP_OUTPUT_FROM_T3, SCTP_SO_NOT_LOCKED);
1091 }
1092}
1093
1094static void
1095sctp_path_check_and_react(struct sctp_tcb *stcb, struct sctp_ifa *newifa)
1096{
1097 struct sctp_nets *net;
1098 int addrnum, changed;
1099
1100 /* If number of local valid addresses is 1, the valid address is
1101 probably newly added address.
1102 Several valid addresses in this association. A source address
1103 may not be changed. Additionally, they can be configured on a
1104 same interface as "alias" addresses. (by micchie)
1105 */
1106 addrnum = sctp_local_addr_count(stcb);
1107 SCTPDBG(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1, "p_check_react(): %d local addresses\n",
1108 addrnum);
1109 if (addrnum == 1) {
1110 TAILQ_FOREACH(net, &stcb->asoc.nets, sctp_next) {
1111 /* clear any cached route and source address */
1112#if defined(__FreeBSD__) && !defined(__Userspace__)
1113 RO_NHFREE(&net->ro);
1114#else
1115 if (net->ro.ro_rt) {
1116 RTFREE(net->ro.ro_rt);
1117 net->ro.ro_rt = NULL;
1118 }
1119#endif
1120 if (net->src_addr_selected) {
1121 sctp_free_ifa(net->ro._s_addr);
1122 net->ro._s_addr = NULL;
1123 net->src_addr_selected = 0;
1124 }
1125 /* Retransmit unacknowledged DATA chunks immediately */
1126 if (sctp_is_mobility_feature_on(stcb->sctp_ep,
1127 SCTP_MOBILITY_FASTHANDOFF)) {
1128 sctp_net_immediate_retrans(stcb, net);
1129 }
1130 /* also, SET PRIMARY is maybe already sent */
1131 }
1132 return;
1133 }
1134
1135 /* Multiple local addresses exsist in the association. */
1136 TAILQ_FOREACH(net, &stcb->asoc.nets, sctp_next) {
1137 /* clear any cached route and source address */
1138#if defined(__FreeBSD__) && !defined(__Userspace__)
1139 RO_NHFREE(&net->ro);
1140#else
1141 if (net->ro.ro_rt) {
1142 RTFREE(net->ro.ro_rt);
1143 net->ro.ro_rt = NULL;
1144 }
1145#endif
1146 if (net->src_addr_selected) {
1147 sctp_free_ifa(net->ro._s_addr);
1148 net->ro._s_addr = NULL;
1149 net->src_addr_selected = 0;
1150 }
1151 /* Check if the nexthop is corresponding to the new address.
1152 If the new address is corresponding to the current nexthop,
1153 the path will be changed.
1154 If the new address is NOT corresponding to the current
1155 nexthop, the path will not be changed.
1156 */
1157 SCTP_RTALLOC((sctp_route_t *)&net->ro,
1158 stcb->sctp_ep->def_vrf_id,
1159 stcb->sctp_ep->fibnum);
1160#if defined(__FreeBSD__) && !defined(__Userspace__)
1161 if (net->ro.ro_nh == NULL)
1162#else
1163 if (net->ro.ro_rt == NULL)
1164#endif
1165 continue;
1166
1167 changed = 0;
1168 switch (net->ro._l_addr.sa.sa_family) {
1169#ifdef INET
1170 case AF_INET:
1171 if (sctp_v4src_match_nexthop(newifa, (sctp_route_t *)&net->ro)) {
1172 changed = 1;
1173 }
1174 break;
1175#endif
1176#ifdef INET6
1177 case AF_INET6:
1178 if (sctp_v6src_match_nexthop(
1179 &newifa->address.sin6, (sctp_route_t *)&net->ro)) {
1180 changed = 1;
1181 }
1182 break;
1183#endif
1184 default:
1185 break;
1186 }
1187 /* if the newly added address does not relate routing
1188 information, we skip.
1189 */
1190 if (changed == 0)
1191 continue;
1192 /* Retransmit unacknowledged DATA chunks immediately */
1193 if (sctp_is_mobility_feature_on(stcb->sctp_ep,
1194 SCTP_MOBILITY_FASTHANDOFF)) {
1195 sctp_net_immediate_retrans(stcb, net);
1196 }
1197 /* Send SET PRIMARY for this new address */
1198 if (net == stcb->asoc.primary_destination) {
1199 (void)sctp_asconf_queue_mgmt(stcb, newifa,
1200 SCTP_SET_PRIM_ADDR);
1201 }
1202 }
1203}
1204#endif
1205
1206/*
1207 * process an ADD/DELETE IP ack from peer.
1208 * addr: corresponding sctp_ifa to the address being added/deleted.
1209 * type: SCTP_ADD_IP_ADDRESS or SCTP_DEL_IP_ADDRESS.
1210 * flag: 1=success, 0=failure.
1211 */
1212static void
1213sctp_asconf_addr_mgmt_ack(struct sctp_tcb *stcb, struct sctp_ifa *addr, uint32_t flag)
1214{
1215 /*
1216 * do the necessary asoc list work- if we get a failure indication,
1217 * leave the address on the assoc's restricted list. If we get a
1218 * success indication, remove the address from the restricted list.
1219 */
1220 /*
1221 * Note: this will only occur for ADD_IP_ADDRESS, since
1222 * DEL_IP_ADDRESS is never actually added to the list...
1223 */
1224 if (flag) {
1225 /* success case, so remove from the restricted list */
1226 sctp_del_local_addr_restricted(stcb, addr);
1227
1228#if defined(__FreeBSD__) || defined(__APPLE__) || defined(__Userspace__)
1229 if (sctp_is_mobility_feature_on(stcb->sctp_ep,
1230 SCTP_MOBILITY_BASE) ||
1231 sctp_is_mobility_feature_on(stcb->sctp_ep,
1232 SCTP_MOBILITY_FASTHANDOFF)) {
1233 sctp_path_check_and_react(stcb, addr);
1234 return;
1235 }
1236#endif
1237 /* clear any cached/topologically incorrect source addresses */
1238 sctp_asconf_nets_cleanup(stcb, addr->ifn_p);
1239 }
1240 /* else, leave it on the list */
1241}
1242
1243/*
1244 * add an asconf add/delete/set primary IP address parameter to the queue.
1245 * type = SCTP_ADD_IP_ADDRESS, SCTP_DEL_IP_ADDRESS, SCTP_SET_PRIM_ADDR.
1246 * returns 0 if queued, -1 if not queued/removed.
1247 * NOTE: if adding, but a delete for the same address is already scheduled
1248 * (and not yet sent out), simply remove it from queue. Same for deleting
1249 * an address already scheduled for add. If a duplicate operation is found,
1250 * ignore the new one.
1251 */
1252static int
1253sctp_asconf_queue_mgmt(struct sctp_tcb *stcb, struct sctp_ifa *ifa,
1254 uint16_t type)
1255{
1256 struct sctp_asconf_addr *aa, *aa_next;
1257
1258 /* make sure the request isn't already in the queue */
1259 TAILQ_FOREACH_SAFE(aa, &stcb->asoc.asconf_queue, next, aa_next) {
1260 /* address match? */
1261 if (sctp_asconf_addr_match(aa, &ifa->address.sa) == 0)
1262 continue;
1263 /* is the request already in queue but not sent?
1264 * pass the request already sent in order to resolve the following case:
1265 * 1. arrival of ADD, then sent
1266 * 2. arrival of DEL. we can't remove the ADD request already sent
1267 * 3. arrival of ADD
1268 */
1269 if (aa->ap.aph.ph.param_type == type && aa->sent == 0) {
1270 return (-1);
1271 }
1272 /* is the negative request already in queue, and not sent */
1273 if ((aa->sent == 0) && (type == SCTP_ADD_IP_ADDRESS) &&
1274 (aa->ap.aph.ph.param_type == SCTP_DEL_IP_ADDRESS)) {
1275 /* add requested, delete already queued */
1276 TAILQ_REMOVE(&stcb->asoc.asconf_queue, aa, next);
1277 /* remove the ifa from the restricted list */
1278 sctp_del_local_addr_restricted(stcb, ifa);
1279 /* free the asconf param */
1280 SCTP_FREE(aa, SCTP_M_ASC_ADDR);
1281 SCTPDBG(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF2, "asconf_queue_mgmt: add removes queued entry\n");
1282 return (-1);
1283 }
1284 if ((aa->sent == 0) && (type == SCTP_DEL_IP_ADDRESS) &&
1285 (aa->ap.aph.ph.param_type == SCTP_ADD_IP_ADDRESS)) {
1286 /* delete requested, add already queued */
1287 TAILQ_REMOVE(&stcb->asoc.asconf_queue, aa, next);
1288 /* remove the aa->ifa from the restricted list */
1289 sctp_del_local_addr_restricted(stcb, aa->ifa);
1290 /* free the asconf param */
1291 SCTP_FREE(aa, SCTP_M_ASC_ADDR);
1292 SCTPDBG(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF2, "asconf_queue_mgmt: delete removes queued entry\n");
1293 return (-1);
1294 }
1295 } /* for each aa */
1296
1297 /* adding new request to the queue */
1298 SCTP_MALLOC(aa, struct sctp_asconf_addr *, sizeof(*aa),
1299 SCTP_M_ASC_ADDR);
1300 if (aa == NULL) {
1301 /* didn't get memory */
1302 SCTPDBG(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1, "asconf_queue_mgmt: failed to get memory!\n");
1303 return (-1);
1304 }
1305 aa->special_del = 0;
1306 /* fill in asconf address parameter fields */
1307 /* top level elements are "networked" during send */
1308 aa->ap.aph.ph.param_type = type;
1309 aa->ifa = ifa;
1310 atomic_add_int(&ifa->refcount, 1);
1311 /* correlation_id filled in during send routine later... */
1312 switch (ifa->address.sa.sa_family) {
1313#ifdef INET6
1314 case AF_INET6:
1315 {
1316 struct sockaddr_in6 *sin6;
1317
1318 sin6 = &ifa->address.sin6;
1319 aa->ap.addrp.ph.param_type = SCTP_IPV6_ADDRESS;
1320 aa->ap.addrp.ph.param_length = (sizeof(struct sctp_ipv6addr_param));
1321 aa->ap.aph.ph.param_length = sizeof(struct sctp_asconf_paramhdr) +
1322 sizeof(struct sctp_ipv6addr_param);
1323 memcpy(&aa->ap.addrp.addr, &sin6->sin6_addr,
1324 sizeof(struct in6_addr));
1325 break;
1326 }
1327#endif
1328#ifdef INET
1329 case AF_INET:
1330 {
1331 struct sockaddr_in *sin;
1332
1333 sin = &ifa->address.sin;
1334 aa->ap.addrp.ph.param_type = SCTP_IPV4_ADDRESS;
1335 aa->ap.addrp.ph.param_length = (sizeof(struct sctp_ipv4addr_param));
1336 aa->ap.aph.ph.param_length = sizeof(struct sctp_asconf_paramhdr) +
1337 sizeof(struct sctp_ipv4addr_param);
1338 memcpy(&aa->ap.addrp.addr, &sin->sin_addr,
1339 sizeof(struct in_addr));
1340 break;
1341 }
1342#endif
1343 default:
1344 /* invalid family! */
1345 SCTP_FREE(aa, SCTP_M_ASC_ADDR);
1346 sctp_free_ifa(ifa);
1347 return (-1);
1348 }
1349 aa->sent = 0; /* clear sent flag */
1350
1351 TAILQ_INSERT_TAIL(&stcb->asoc.asconf_queue, aa, next);
1352#ifdef SCTP_DEBUG
1353 if (SCTP_BASE_SYSCTL(sctp_debug_on) & SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF2) {
1354 if (type == SCTP_ADD_IP_ADDRESS) {
1355 SCTP_PRINTF("asconf_queue_mgmt: inserted asconf ADD_IP_ADDRESS: ");
1356 SCTPDBG_ADDR(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF2, &ifa->address.sa);
1357 } else if (type == SCTP_DEL_IP_ADDRESS) {
1358 SCTP_PRINTF("asconf_queue_mgmt: appended asconf DEL_IP_ADDRESS: ");
1359 SCTPDBG_ADDR(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF2, &ifa->address.sa);
1360 } else {
1361 SCTP_PRINTF("asconf_queue_mgmt: appended asconf SET_PRIM_ADDR: ");
1362 SCTPDBG_ADDR(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF2, &ifa->address.sa);
1363 }
1364 }
1365#endif
1366
1367 return (0);
1368}
1369
1370/*
1371 * add an asconf operation for the given ifa and type.
1372 * type = SCTP_ADD_IP_ADDRESS, SCTP_DEL_IP_ADDRESS, SCTP_SET_PRIM_ADDR.
1373 * returns 0 if completed, -1 if not completed, 1 if immediate send is
1374 * advisable.
1375 */
1376static int
1377sctp_asconf_queue_add(struct sctp_tcb *stcb, struct sctp_ifa *ifa,
1378 uint16_t type)
1379{
1380 uint32_t status;
1381 int pending_delete_queued = 0;
1382 int last;
1383
1384 /* see if peer supports ASCONF */
1385 if (stcb->asoc.asconf_supported == 0) {
1386 return (-1);
1387 }
1388
1389 /*
1390 * if this is deleting the last address from the assoc, mark it as
1391 * pending.
1392 */
1393 if ((type == SCTP_DEL_IP_ADDRESS) && !stcb->asoc.asconf_del_pending) {
1394 if (stcb->sctp_ep->sctp_flags & SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_BOUNDALL) {
1395 last = (sctp_local_addr_count(stcb) == 0);
1396 } else {
1397 last = (sctp_local_addr_count(stcb) == 1);
1398 }
1399 if (last) {
1400 /* set the pending delete info only */
1401 stcb->asoc.asconf_del_pending = 1;
1402 stcb->asoc.asconf_addr_del_pending = ifa;
1403 atomic_add_int(&ifa->refcount, 1);
1404 SCTPDBG(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF2,
1405 "asconf_queue_add: mark delete last address pending\n");
1406 return (-1);
1407 }
1408 }
1409
1410 /* queue an asconf parameter */
1411 status = sctp_asconf_queue_mgmt(stcb, ifa, type);
1412
1413 /*
1414 * if this is an add, and there is a delete also pending (i.e. the
1415 * last local address is being changed), queue the pending delete too.
1416 */
1417 if ((type == SCTP_ADD_IP_ADDRESS) && stcb->asoc.asconf_del_pending && (status == 0)) {
1418 /* queue in the pending delete */
1419 if (sctp_asconf_queue_mgmt(stcb,
1420 stcb->asoc.asconf_addr_del_pending,
1421 SCTP_DEL_IP_ADDRESS) == 0) {
1422 SCTPDBG(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF2, "asconf_queue_add: queuing pending delete\n");
1423 pending_delete_queued = 1;
1424 /* clear out the pending delete info */
1425 stcb->asoc.asconf_del_pending = 0;
1426 sctp_free_ifa(stcb->asoc.asconf_addr_del_pending);
1427 stcb->asoc.asconf_addr_del_pending = NULL;
1428 }
1429 }
1430
1431 if (pending_delete_queued) {
1432 struct sctp_nets *net;
1433 /*
1434 * since we know that the only/last address is now being
1435 * changed in this case, reset the cwnd/rto on all nets to
1436 * start as a new address and path. Also clear the error
1437 * counts to give the assoc the best chance to complete the
1438 * address change.
1439 */
1440 TAILQ_FOREACH(net, &stcb->asoc.nets, sctp_next) {
1441 stcb->asoc.cc_functions.sctp_set_initial_cc_param(stcb,
1442 net);
1443 net->RTO = 0;
1444 net->error_count = 0;
1445 }
1446 stcb->asoc.overall_error_count = 0;
1447 if (SCTP_BASE_SYSCTL(sctp_logging_level) & SCTP_THRESHOLD_LOGGING) {
1448 sctp_misc_ints(SCTP_THRESHOLD_CLEAR,
1449 stcb->asoc.overall_error_count,
1450 0,
1451 SCTP_FROM_SCTP_ASCONF,
1452 __LINE__);
1453 }
1454
1455 /* queue in an advisory set primary too */
1456 (void)sctp_asconf_queue_mgmt(stcb, ifa, SCTP_SET_PRIM_ADDR);
1457 /* let caller know we should send this out immediately */
1458 status = 1;
1459 }
1460 return (status);
1461}
1462
1463/*-
1464 * add an asconf delete IP address parameter to the queue by sockaddr and
1465 * possibly with no sctp_ifa available. This is only called by the routine
1466 * that checks the addresses in an INIT-ACK against the current address list.
1467 * returns 0 if completed, non-zero if not completed.
1468 * NOTE: if an add is already scheduled (and not yet sent out), simply
1469 * remove it from queue. If a duplicate operation is found, ignore the
1470 * new one.
1471 */
1472static int
1473sctp_asconf_queue_sa_delete(struct sctp_tcb *stcb, struct sockaddr *sa)
1474{
1475 struct sctp_ifa *ifa;
1476 struct sctp_asconf_addr *aa, *aa_next;
1477
1478 if (stcb == NULL) {
1479 return (-1);
1480 }
1481 /* see if peer supports ASCONF */
1482 if (stcb->asoc.asconf_supported == 0) {
1483 return (-1);
1484 }
1485 /* make sure the request isn't already in the queue */
1486 TAILQ_FOREACH_SAFE(aa, &stcb->asoc.asconf_queue, next, aa_next) {
1487 /* address match? */
1488 if (sctp_asconf_addr_match(aa, sa) == 0)
1489 continue;
1490 /* is the request already in queue (sent or not) */
1491 if (aa->ap.aph.ph.param_type == SCTP_DEL_IP_ADDRESS) {
1492 return (-1);
1493 }
1494 /* is the negative request already in queue, and not sent */
1495 if (aa->sent == 1)
1496 continue;
1497 if (aa->ap.aph.ph.param_type == SCTP_ADD_IP_ADDRESS) {
1498 /* add already queued, so remove existing entry */
1499 TAILQ_REMOVE(&stcb->asoc.asconf_queue, aa, next);
1500 sctp_del_local_addr_restricted(stcb, aa->ifa);
1501 /* free the entry */
1502 SCTP_FREE(aa, SCTP_M_ASC_ADDR);
1503 return (-1);
1504 }
1505 } /* for each aa */
1506
1507 /* find any existing ifa-- NOTE ifa CAN be allowed to be NULL */
1508 ifa = sctp_find_ifa_by_addr(sa, stcb->asoc.vrf_id, SCTP_ADDR_NOT_LOCKED);
1509
1510 /* adding new request to the queue */
1511 SCTP_MALLOC(aa, struct sctp_asconf_addr *, sizeof(*aa),
1512 SCTP_M_ASC_ADDR);
1513 if (aa == NULL) {
1514 /* didn't get memory */
1515 SCTPDBG(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1,
1516 "sctp_asconf_queue_sa_delete: failed to get memory!\n");
1517 return (-1);
1518 }
1519 aa->special_del = 0;
1520 /* fill in asconf address parameter fields */
1521 /* top level elements are "networked" during send */
1522 aa->ap.aph.ph.param_type = SCTP_DEL_IP_ADDRESS;
1523 aa->ifa = ifa;
1524 if (ifa)
1525 atomic_add_int(&ifa->refcount, 1);
1526 /* correlation_id filled in during send routine later... */
1527 switch (sa->sa_family) {
1528#ifdef INET6
1529 case AF_INET6:
1530 {
1531 /* IPv6 address */
1532 struct sockaddr_in6 *sin6;
1533
1534 sin6 = (struct sockaddr_in6 *)sa;
1535 aa->ap.addrp.ph.param_type = SCTP_IPV6_ADDRESS;
1536 aa->ap.addrp.ph.param_length = (sizeof(struct sctp_ipv6addr_param));
1537 aa->ap.aph.ph.param_length = sizeof(struct sctp_asconf_paramhdr) + sizeof(struct sctp_ipv6addr_param);
1538 memcpy(&aa->ap.addrp.addr, &sin6->sin6_addr,
1539 sizeof(struct in6_addr));
1540 break;
1541 }
1542#endif
1543#ifdef INET
1544 case AF_INET:
1545 {
1546 /* IPv4 address */
1547 struct sockaddr_in *sin = (struct sockaddr_in *)sa;
1548
1549 aa->ap.addrp.ph.param_type = SCTP_IPV4_ADDRESS;
1550 aa->ap.addrp.ph.param_length = (sizeof(struct sctp_ipv4addr_param));
1551 aa->ap.aph.ph.param_length = sizeof(struct sctp_asconf_paramhdr) + sizeof(struct sctp_ipv4addr_param);
1552 memcpy(&aa->ap.addrp.addr, &sin->sin_addr,
1553 sizeof(struct in_addr));
1554 break;
1555 }
1556#endif
1557 default:
1558 /* invalid family! */
1559 SCTP_FREE(aa, SCTP_M_ASC_ADDR);
1560 if (ifa)
1561 sctp_free_ifa(ifa);
1562 return (-1);
1563 }
1564 aa->sent = 0; /* clear sent flag */
1565
1566 /* delete goes to the back of the queue */
1567 TAILQ_INSERT_TAIL(&stcb->asoc.asconf_queue, aa, next);
1568
1569 /* sa_ignore MEMLEAK {memory is put on the tailq} */
1570 return (0);
1571}
1572
1573/*
1574 * find a specific asconf param on our "sent" queue
1575 */
1576static struct sctp_asconf_addr *
1577sctp_asconf_find_param(struct sctp_tcb *stcb, uint32_t correlation_id)
1578{
1579 struct sctp_asconf_addr *aa;
1580
1581 TAILQ_FOREACH(aa, &stcb->asoc.asconf_queue, next) {
1582 if (aa->ap.aph.correlation_id == correlation_id &&
1583 aa->sent == 1) {
1584 /* found it */
1585 return (aa);
1586 }
1587 }
1588 /* didn't find it */
1589 return (NULL);
1590}
1591
1592/*
1593 * process an SCTP_ERROR_CAUSE_IND for a ASCONF-ACK parameter and do
1594 * notifications based on the error response
1595 */
1596static void
1597sctp_asconf_process_error(struct sctp_tcb *stcb SCTP_UNUSED,
1598 struct sctp_asconf_paramhdr *aph)
1599{
1600 struct sctp_error_cause *eh;
1601 struct sctp_paramhdr *ph;
1602 uint16_t param_type;
1603 uint16_t error_code;
1604
1605 eh = (struct sctp_error_cause *)(aph + 1);
1606 ph = (struct sctp_paramhdr *)(eh + 1);
1607 /* validate lengths */
1608 if (htons(eh->length) + sizeof(struct sctp_error_cause) >
1609 htons(aph->ph.param_length)) {
1610 /* invalid error cause length */
1611 SCTPDBG(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1,
1612 "asconf_process_error: cause element too long\n");
1613 return;
1614 }
1615 if (htons(ph->param_length) + sizeof(struct sctp_paramhdr) >
1616 htons(eh->length)) {
1617 /* invalid included TLV length */
1618 SCTPDBG(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1,
1619 "asconf_process_error: included TLV too long\n");
1620 return;
1621 }
1622 /* which error code ? */
1623 error_code = ntohs(eh->code);
1624 param_type = ntohs(aph->ph.param_type);
1625 /* FIX: this should go back up the REMOTE_ERROR ULP notify */
1626 switch (error_code) {
1627 case SCTP_CAUSE_RESOURCE_SHORTAGE:
1628 /* we allow ourselves to "try again" for this error */
1629 break;
1630 default:
1631 /* peer can't handle it... */
1632 switch (param_type) {
1633 case SCTP_ADD_IP_ADDRESS:
1634 case SCTP_DEL_IP_ADDRESS:
1635 case SCTP_SET_PRIM_ADDR:
1636 break;
1637 default:
1638 break;
1639 }
1640 }
1641}
1642
1643/*
1644 * process an asconf queue param.
1645 * aparam: parameter to process, will be removed from the queue.
1646 * flag: 1=success case, 0=failure case
1647 */
1648static void
1649sctp_asconf_process_param_ack(struct sctp_tcb *stcb,
1650 struct sctp_asconf_addr *aparam, uint32_t flag)
1651{
1652 uint16_t param_type;
1653
1654 /* process this param */
1655 param_type = aparam->ap.aph.ph.param_type;
1656 switch (param_type) {
1657 case SCTP_ADD_IP_ADDRESS:
1658 SCTPDBG(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1,
1659 "process_param_ack: added IP address\n");
1660 sctp_asconf_addr_mgmt_ack(stcb, aparam->ifa, flag);
1661 break;
1662 case SCTP_DEL_IP_ADDRESS:
1663 SCTPDBG(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1,
1664 "process_param_ack: deleted IP address\n");
1665 /* nothing really to do... lists already updated */
1666 break;
1667 case SCTP_SET_PRIM_ADDR:
1668 SCTPDBG(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1,
1669 "process_param_ack: set primary IP address\n");
1670 /* nothing to do... peer may start using this addr */
1671 break;
1672 default:
1673 /* should NEVER happen */
1674 break;
1675 }
1676
1677 /* remove the param and free it */
1678 TAILQ_REMOVE(&stcb->asoc.asconf_queue, aparam, next);
1679 if (aparam->ifa)
1680 sctp_free_ifa(aparam->ifa);
1681 SCTP_FREE(aparam, SCTP_M_ASC_ADDR);
1682}
1683
1684/*
1685 * cleanup from a bad asconf ack parameter
1686 */
1687static void
1688sctp_asconf_ack_clear(struct sctp_tcb *stcb SCTP_UNUSED)
1689{
1690 /* assume peer doesn't really know how to do asconfs */
1691 /* XXX we could free the pending queue here */
1692
1693}
1694
1695void
1696sctp_handle_asconf_ack(struct mbuf *m, int offset,
1697 struct sctp_asconf_ack_chunk *cp, struct sctp_tcb *stcb,
1698 struct sctp_nets *net, int *abort_no_unlock)
1699{
1700 struct sctp_association *asoc;
1701 uint32_t serial_num;
1702 uint16_t ack_length;
1703 struct sctp_asconf_paramhdr *aph;
1704 struct sctp_asconf_addr *aa, *aa_next;
1705 uint32_t last_error_id = 0; /* last error correlation id */
1706 uint32_t id;
1707 struct sctp_asconf_addr *ap;
1708
1709 /* asconf param buffer */
1710 uint8_t aparam_buf[SCTP_PARAM_BUFFER_SIZE];
1711
1712 /* verify minimum length */
1713 if (ntohs(cp->ch.chunk_length) < sizeof(struct sctp_asconf_ack_chunk)) {
1714 SCTPDBG(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1,
1715 "handle_asconf_ack: chunk too small = %xh\n",
1716 ntohs(cp->ch.chunk_length));
1717 return;
1718 }
1719 asoc = &stcb->asoc;
1720 serial_num = ntohl(cp->serial_number);
1721
1722 /*
1723 * NOTE: we may want to handle this differently- currently, we will
1724 * abort when we get an ack for the expected serial number + 1 (eg.
1725 * we didn't send it), process an ack normally if it is the expected
1726 * serial number, and re-send the previous ack for *ALL* other
1727 * serial numbers
1728 */
1729
1730 /*
1731 * if the serial number is the next expected, but I didn't send it,
1732 * abort the asoc, since someone probably just hijacked us...
1733 */
1734 if (serial_num == (asoc->asconf_seq_out + 1)) {
1735 struct mbuf *op_err;
1736 char msg[SCTP_DIAG_INFO_LEN];
1737
1738 SCTPDBG(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1, "handle_asconf_ack: got unexpected next serial number! Aborting asoc!\n");
1739 SCTP_SNPRINTF(msg, sizeof(msg), "Never sent serial number %8.8x", serial_num);
1740 op_err = sctp_generate_cause(SCTP_CAUSE_PROTOCOL_VIOLATION, msg);
1741 sctp_abort_an_association(stcb->sctp_ep, stcb, op_err, SCTP_SO_NOT_LOCKED);
1742 *abort_no_unlock = 1;
1743 return;
1744 }
1745 if (serial_num != asoc->asconf_seq_out_acked + 1) {
1746 /* got a duplicate/unexpected ASCONF-ACK */
1747 SCTPDBG(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1, "handle_asconf_ack: got duplicate/unexpected serial number = %xh (expected = %xh)\n",
1748 serial_num, asoc->asconf_seq_out_acked + 1);
1749 return;
1750 }
1751
1752 if (serial_num == asoc->asconf_seq_out - 1) {
1753 /* stop our timer */
1754 sctp_timer_stop(SCTP_TIMER_TYPE_ASCONF, stcb->sctp_ep, stcb, NULL,
1755 SCTP_FROM_SCTP_ASCONF + SCTP_LOC_5);
1756 }
1757
1758 /* process the ASCONF-ACK contents */
1759 ack_length = ntohs(cp->ch.chunk_length) -
1760 sizeof(struct sctp_asconf_ack_chunk);
1761 offset += sizeof(struct sctp_asconf_ack_chunk);
1762 /* process through all parameters */
1763 while (ack_length >= sizeof(struct sctp_asconf_paramhdr)) {
1764 unsigned int param_length, param_type;
1765
1766 /* get pointer to next asconf parameter */
1767 aph = (struct sctp_asconf_paramhdr *)sctp_m_getptr(m, offset,
1768 sizeof(struct sctp_asconf_paramhdr), aparam_buf);
1769 if (aph == NULL) {
1770 /* can't get an asconf paramhdr */
1771 sctp_asconf_ack_clear(stcb);
1772 return;
1773 }
1774 param_type = ntohs(aph->ph.param_type);
1775 param_length = ntohs(aph->ph.param_length);
1776 if (param_length > ack_length) {
1777 sctp_asconf_ack_clear(stcb);
1778 return;
1779 }
1780 if (param_length < sizeof(struct sctp_asconf_paramhdr)) {
1781 sctp_asconf_ack_clear(stcb);
1782 return;
1783 }
1784 /* get the complete parameter... */
1785 if (param_length > sizeof(aparam_buf)) {
1786 SCTPDBG(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1,
1787 "param length (%u) larger than buffer size!\n", param_length);
1788 sctp_asconf_ack_clear(stcb);
1789 return;
1790 }
1791 aph = (struct sctp_asconf_paramhdr *)sctp_m_getptr(m, offset, param_length, aparam_buf);
1792 if (aph == NULL) {
1793 sctp_asconf_ack_clear(stcb);
1794 return;
1795 }
1796 /* correlation_id is transparent to peer, no ntohl needed */
1797 id = aph->correlation_id;
1798
1799 switch (param_type) {
1800 case SCTP_ERROR_CAUSE_IND:
1801 last_error_id = id;
1802 /* find the corresponding asconf param in our queue */
1803 ap = sctp_asconf_find_param(stcb, id);
1804 if (ap == NULL) {
1805 /* hmm... can't find this in our queue! */
1806 break;
1807 }
1808 /* process the parameter, failed flag */
1809 sctp_asconf_process_param_ack(stcb, ap, 0);
1810 /* process the error response */
1811 sctp_asconf_process_error(stcb, aph);
1812 break;
1813 case SCTP_SUCCESS_REPORT:
1814 /* find the corresponding asconf param in our queue */
1815 ap = sctp_asconf_find_param(stcb, id);
1816 if (ap == NULL) {
1817 /* hmm... can't find this in our queue! */
1818 break;
1819 }
1820 /* process the parameter, success flag */
1821 sctp_asconf_process_param_ack(stcb, ap, 1);
1822 break;
1823 default:
1824 break;
1825 } /* switch */
1826
1827 /* update remaining ASCONF-ACK message length to process */
1828 if (ack_length > SCTP_SIZE32(param_length)) {
1829 ack_length -= SCTP_SIZE32(param_length);
1830 } else {
1831 break;
1832 }
1833 offset += SCTP_SIZE32(param_length);
1834 } /* while */
1835
1836 /*
1837 * if there are any "sent" params still on the queue, these are
1838 * implicitly "success", or "failed" (if we got an error back) ...
1839 * so process these appropriately
1840 *
1841 * we assume that the correlation_id's are monotonically increasing
1842 * beginning from 1 and that we don't have *that* many outstanding
1843 * at any given time
1844 */
1845 if (last_error_id == 0)
1846 last_error_id--; /* set to "max" value */
1847 TAILQ_FOREACH_SAFE(aa, &stcb->asoc.asconf_queue, next, aa_next) {
1848 if (aa->sent == 1) {
1849 /*
1850 * implicitly successful or failed if correlation_id
1851 * < last_error_id, then success else, failure
1852 */
1853 if (aa->ap.aph.correlation_id < last_error_id)
1854 sctp_asconf_process_param_ack(stcb, aa, 1);
1855 else
1856 sctp_asconf_process_param_ack(stcb, aa, 0);
1857 } else {
1858 /*
1859 * since we always process in order (FIFO queue) if
1860 * we reach one that hasn't been sent, the rest
1861 * should not have been sent either. so, we're
1862 * done...
1863 */
1864 break;
1865 }
1866 }
1867
1868 /* update the next sequence number to use */
1869 asoc->asconf_seq_out_acked++;
1870 /* remove the old ASCONF on our outbound queue */
1871 sctp_toss_old_asconf(stcb);
1872 if (!TAILQ_EMPTY(&stcb->asoc.asconf_queue)) {
1873#ifdef SCTP_TIMER_BASED_ASCONF
1874 /* we have more params, so restart our timer */
1875 sctp_timer_start(SCTP_TIMER_TYPE_ASCONF, stcb->sctp_ep,
1876 stcb, net);
1877#else
1878 /* we have more params, so send out more */
1879 sctp_send_asconf(stcb, net, SCTP_ADDR_NOT_LOCKED);
1880#endif
1881 }
1882}
1883
1884#ifdef INET6
1885static uint32_t
1886sctp_is_scopeid_in_nets(struct sctp_tcb *stcb, struct sockaddr *sa)
1887{
1888 struct sockaddr_in6 *sin6, *net6;
1889 struct sctp_nets *net;
1890
1891 if (sa->sa_family != AF_INET6) {
1892 /* wrong family */
1893 return (0);
1894 }
1895 sin6 = (struct sockaddr_in6 *)sa;
1896 if (IN6_IS_ADDR_LINKLOCAL(&sin6->sin6_addr) == 0) {
1897 /* not link local address */
1898 return (0);
1899 }
1900 /* hunt through our destination nets list for this scope_id */
1901 TAILQ_FOREACH(net, &stcb->asoc.nets, sctp_next) {
1902 if (((struct sockaddr *)(&net->ro._l_addr))->sa_family !=
1903 AF_INET6)
1904 continue;
1905 net6 = (struct sockaddr_in6 *)&net->ro._l_addr;
1906 if (IN6_IS_ADDR_LINKLOCAL(&net6->sin6_addr) == 0)
1907 continue;
1908 if (sctp_is_same_scope(sin6, net6)) {
1909 /* found one */
1910 return (1);
1911 }
1912 }
1913 /* didn't find one */
1914 return (0);
1915}
1916#endif
1917
1918/*
1919 * address management functions
1920 */
1921static void
1922sctp_addr_mgmt_assoc(struct sctp_inpcb *inp, struct sctp_tcb *stcb,
1923 struct sctp_ifa *ifa, uint16_t type, int addr_locked)
1924{
1925 int status;
1926
1927 if ((inp->sctp_flags & SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_BOUNDALL) == 0 ||
1928 sctp_is_feature_off(inp, SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_DO_ASCONF)) {
1929 /* subset bound, no ASCONF allowed case, so ignore */
1930 return;
1931 }
1932 /*
1933 * note: we know this is not the subset bound, no ASCONF case eg.
1934 * this is boundall or subset bound w/ASCONF allowed
1935 */
1936
1937 /* first, make sure that the address is IPv4 or IPv6 and not jailed */
1938 switch (ifa->address.sa.sa_family) {
1939#ifdef INET6
1940 case AF_INET6:
1941#if defined(__FreeBSD__) && !defined(__Userspace__)
1942 if (prison_check_ip6(inp->ip_inp.inp.inp_cred,
1943 &ifa->address.sin6.sin6_addr) != 0) {
1944 return;
1945 }
1946#endif
1947 break;
1948#endif
1949#ifdef INET
1950 case AF_INET:
1951#if defined(__FreeBSD__) && !defined(__Userspace__)
1952 if (prison_check_ip4(inp->ip_inp.inp.inp_cred,
1953 &ifa->address.sin.sin_addr) != 0) {
1954 return;
1955 }
1956#endif
1957 break;
1958#endif
1959 default:
1960 return;
1961 }
1962#ifdef INET6
1963 /* make sure we're "allowed" to add this type of addr */
1964 if (ifa->address.sa.sa_family == AF_INET6) {
1965 /* invalid if we're not a v6 endpoint */
1966 if ((inp->sctp_flags & SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_BOUND_V6) == 0)
1967 return;
1968 /* is the v6 addr really valid ? */
1969 if (ifa->localifa_flags & SCTP_ADDR_IFA_UNUSEABLE) {
1970 return;
1971 }
1972 }
1973#endif
1974 /* put this address on the "pending/do not use yet" list */
1975 sctp_add_local_addr_restricted(stcb, ifa);
1976 /*
1977 * check address scope if address is out of scope, don't queue
1978 * anything... note: this would leave the address on both inp and
1979 * asoc lists
1980 */
1981 switch (ifa->address.sa.sa_family) {
1982#ifdef INET6
1983 case AF_INET6:
1984 {
1985 struct sockaddr_in6 *sin6;
1986
1987 sin6 = &ifa->address.sin6;
1988 if (IN6_IS_ADDR_UNSPECIFIED(&sin6->sin6_addr)) {
1989 /* we skip unspecifed addresses */
1990 return;
1991 }
1992 if (IN6_IS_ADDR_LINKLOCAL(&sin6->sin6_addr)) {
1993 if (stcb->asoc.scope.local_scope == 0) {
1994 return;
1995 }
1996 /* is it the right link local scope? */
1997 if (sctp_is_scopeid_in_nets(stcb, &ifa->address.sa) == 0) {
1998 return;
1999 }
2000 }
2001 if (stcb->asoc.scope.site_scope == 0 &&
2002 IN6_IS_ADDR_SITELOCAL(&sin6->sin6_addr)) {
2003 return;
2004 }
2005 break;
2006 }
2007#endif
2008#ifdef INET
2009 case AF_INET:
2010 {
2011 struct sockaddr_in *sin;
2012
2013 /* invalid if we are a v6 only endpoint */
2014 if ((inp->sctp_flags & SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_BOUND_V6) &&
2015 SCTP_IPV6_V6ONLY(inp))
2016 return;
2017
2018 sin = &ifa->address.sin;
2019 if (sin->sin_addr.s_addr == 0) {
2020 /* we skip unspecifed addresses */
2021 return;
2022 }
2023 if (stcb->asoc.scope.ipv4_local_scope == 0 &&
2024 IN4_ISPRIVATE_ADDRESS(&sin->sin_addr)) {
2025 return;
2026 }
2027 break;
2028 }
2029#endif
2030 default:
2031 /* else, not AF_INET or AF_INET6, so skip */
2032 return;
2033 }
2034
2035 /* queue an asconf for this address add/delete */
2036 if (sctp_is_feature_on(inp, SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_DO_ASCONF)) {
2037 /* does the peer do asconf? */
2038 if (stcb->asoc.asconf_supported) {
2039 /* queue an asconf for this addr */
2040 status = sctp_asconf_queue_add(stcb, ifa, type);
2041
2042 /*
2043 * if queued ok, and in the open state, send out the
2044 * ASCONF. If in the non-open state, these will be
2045 * sent when the state goes open.
2046 */
2047 if (status == 0 &&
2048 ((SCTP_GET_STATE(stcb) == SCTP_STATE_OPEN) ||
2049 (SCTP_GET_STATE(stcb) == SCTP_STATE_SHUTDOWN_RECEIVED))) {
2050#ifdef SCTP_TIMER_BASED_ASCONF
2051 sctp_timer_start(SCTP_TIMER_TYPE_ASCONF, inp,
2052 stcb, stcb->asoc.primary_destination);
2053#else
2054 sctp_send_asconf(stcb, NULL, addr_locked);
2055#endif
2056 }
2057 }
2058 }
2059}
2060
2061int
2062sctp_asconf_iterator_ep(struct sctp_inpcb *inp, void *ptr, uint32_t val SCTP_UNUSED)
2063{
2064 struct sctp_asconf_iterator *asc;
2065 struct sctp_ifa *ifa;
2066 struct sctp_laddr *l;
2067 int cnt_invalid = 0;
2068
2069 asc = (struct sctp_asconf_iterator *)ptr;
2070 LIST_FOREACH(l, &asc->list_of_work, sctp_nxt_addr) {
2071 ifa = l->ifa;
2072 switch (ifa->address.sa.sa_family) {
2073#ifdef INET6
2074 case AF_INET6:
2075 /* invalid if we're not a v6 endpoint */
2076 if ((inp->sctp_flags & SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_BOUND_V6) == 0) {
2077 cnt_invalid++;
2078 if (asc->cnt == cnt_invalid)
2079 return (1);
2080 }
2081 break;
2082#endif
2083#ifdef INET
2084 case AF_INET:
2085 {
2086 /* invalid if we are a v6 only endpoint */
2087 if ((inp->sctp_flags & SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_BOUND_V6) &&
2088 SCTP_IPV6_V6ONLY(inp)) {
2089 cnt_invalid++;
2090 if (asc->cnt == cnt_invalid)
2091 return (1);
2092 }
2093 break;
2094 }
2095#endif
2096 default:
2097 /* invalid address family */
2098 cnt_invalid++;
2099 if (asc->cnt == cnt_invalid)
2100 return (1);
2101 }
2102 }
2103 return (0);
2104}
2105
2106static int
2107sctp_asconf_iterator_ep_end(struct sctp_inpcb *inp, void *ptr, uint32_t val SCTP_UNUSED)
2108{
2109 struct sctp_ifa *ifa;
2110 struct sctp_asconf_iterator *asc;
2111 struct sctp_laddr *laddr, *nladdr, *l;
2112
2113 /* Only for specific case not bound all */
2114 asc = (struct sctp_asconf_iterator *)ptr;
2115 LIST_FOREACH(l, &asc->list_of_work, sctp_nxt_addr) {
2116 ifa = l->ifa;
2117 if (l->action == SCTP_ADD_IP_ADDRESS) {
2118 LIST_FOREACH(laddr, &inp->sctp_addr_list,
2119 sctp_nxt_addr) {
2120 if (laddr->ifa == ifa) {
2121 laddr->action = 0;
2122 break;
2123 }
2124 }
2125 } else if (l->action == SCTP_DEL_IP_ADDRESS) {
2126 LIST_FOREACH_SAFE(laddr, &inp->sctp_addr_list, sctp_nxt_addr, nladdr) {
2127 /* remove only after all guys are done */
2128 if (laddr->ifa == ifa) {
2129 sctp_del_local_addr_ep(inp, ifa);
2130 }
2131 }
2132 }
2133 }
2134 return (0);
2135}
2136
2137void
2138sctp_asconf_iterator_stcb(struct sctp_inpcb *inp, struct sctp_tcb *stcb,
2139 void *ptr, uint32_t val SCTP_UNUSED)
2140{
2141 struct sctp_asconf_iterator *asc;
2142 struct sctp_ifa *ifa;
2143 struct sctp_laddr *l;
2144 int cnt_invalid = 0;
2145 int type, status;
2146 int num_queued = 0;
2147
2148 asc = (struct sctp_asconf_iterator *)ptr;
2149 LIST_FOREACH(l, &asc->list_of_work, sctp_nxt_addr) {
2150 ifa = l->ifa;
2151 type = l->action;
2152
2153 /* address's vrf_id must be the vrf_id of the assoc */
2154 if (ifa->vrf_id != stcb->asoc.vrf_id) {
2155 continue;
2156 }
2157
2158 /* Same checks again for assoc */
2159 switch (ifa->address.sa.sa_family) {
2160#ifdef INET6
2161 case AF_INET6:
2162 {
2163 /* invalid if we're not a v6 endpoint */
2164 struct sockaddr_in6 *sin6;
2165
2166 if ((inp->sctp_flags & SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_BOUND_V6) == 0) {
2167 cnt_invalid++;
2168 if (asc->cnt == cnt_invalid)
2169 return;
2170 else
2171 continue;
2172 }
2173 sin6 = &ifa->address.sin6;
2174 if (IN6_IS_ADDR_UNSPECIFIED(&sin6->sin6_addr)) {
2175 /* we skip unspecifed addresses */
2176 continue;
2177 }
2178#if defined(__FreeBSD__) && !defined(__Userspace__)
2179 if (prison_check_ip6(inp->ip_inp.inp.inp_cred,
2180 &sin6->sin6_addr) != 0) {
2181 continue;
2182 }
2183#endif
2184 if (IN6_IS_ADDR_LINKLOCAL(&sin6->sin6_addr)) {
2185 if (stcb->asoc.scope.local_scope == 0) {
2186 continue;
2187 }
2188 /* is it the right link local scope? */
2189 if (sctp_is_scopeid_in_nets(stcb, &ifa->address.sa) == 0) {
2190 continue;
2191 }
2192 }
2193 break;
2194 }
2195#endif
2196#ifdef INET
2197 case AF_INET:
2198 {
2199 /* invalid if we are a v6 only endpoint */
2200 struct sockaddr_in *sin;
2201
2202 /* invalid if we are a v6 only endpoint */
2203 if ((inp->sctp_flags & SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_BOUND_V6) &&
2204 SCTP_IPV6_V6ONLY(inp))
2205 continue;
2206
2207 sin = &ifa->address.sin;
2208 if (sin->sin_addr.s_addr == 0) {
2209 /* we skip unspecifed addresses */
2210 continue;
2211 }
2212#if defined(__FreeBSD__) && !defined(__Userspace__)
2213 if (prison_check_ip4(inp->ip_inp.inp.inp_cred,
2214 &sin->sin_addr) != 0) {
2215 continue;
2216 }
2217#endif
2218 if (stcb->asoc.scope.ipv4_local_scope == 0 &&
2219 IN4_ISPRIVATE_ADDRESS(&sin->sin_addr)) {
2220 continue;
2221 }
2222 if ((inp->sctp_flags & SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_BOUND_V6) &&
2223 SCTP_IPV6_V6ONLY(inp)) {
2224 cnt_invalid++;
2225 if (asc->cnt == cnt_invalid)
2226 return;
2227 else
2228 continue;
2229 }
2230 break;
2231 }
2232#endif
2233 default:
2234 /* invalid address family */
2235 cnt_invalid++;
2236 if (asc->cnt == cnt_invalid)
2237 return;
2238 else
2239 continue;
2240 break;
2241 }
2242
2243 if (type == SCTP_ADD_IP_ADDRESS) {
2244 /* prevent this address from being used as a source */
2245 sctp_add_local_addr_restricted(stcb, ifa);
2246 } else if (type == SCTP_DEL_IP_ADDRESS) {
2247 struct sctp_nets *net;
2248 TAILQ_FOREACH(net, &stcb->asoc.nets, sctp_next) {
2249 /* delete this address if cached */
2250 if (net->ro._s_addr == ifa) {
2251 sctp_free_ifa(net->ro._s_addr);
2252 net->ro._s_addr = NULL;
2253 net->src_addr_selected = 0;
2254#if defined(__FreeBSD__) && !defined(__Userspace__)
2255 RO_NHFREE(&net->ro);
2256#else
2257 if (net->ro.ro_rt) {
2258 RTFREE(net->ro.ro_rt);
2259 net->ro.ro_rt = NULL;
2260 }
2261#endif
2262 /*
2263 * Now we deleted our src address,
2264 * should we not also now reset the
2265 * cwnd/rto to start as if its a new
2266 * address?
2267 */
2268 stcb->asoc.cc_functions.sctp_set_initial_cc_param(stcb, net);
2269 net->RTO = 0;
2270 }
2271 }
2272 } else if (type == SCTP_SET_PRIM_ADDR) {
2273 if ((stcb->sctp_ep->sctp_flags & SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_BOUNDALL) == 0) {
2274 /* must validate the ifa is in the ep */
2275 if (sctp_is_addr_in_ep(stcb->sctp_ep, ifa) == 0) {
2276 continue;
2277 }
2278 } else {
2279 /* Need to check scopes for this guy */
2280 if (sctp_is_address_in_scope(ifa, &stcb->asoc.scope, 0) == 0) {
2281 continue;
2282 }
2283 }
2284 }
2285 /* queue an asconf for this address add/delete */
2286 if (sctp_is_feature_on(inp, SCTP_PCB_FLAGS_DO_ASCONF) &&
2287 stcb->asoc.asconf_supported == 1) {
2288 /* queue an asconf for this addr */
2289 status = sctp_asconf_queue_add(stcb, ifa, type);
2290 /*
2291 * if queued ok, and in the open state, update the
2292 * count of queued params. If in the non-open state,
2293 * these get sent when the assoc goes open.
2294 */
2295 if ((SCTP_GET_STATE(stcb) == SCTP_STATE_OPEN) ||
2296 (SCTP_GET_STATE(stcb) == SCTP_STATE_SHUTDOWN_RECEIVED)) {
2297 if (status >= 0) {
2298 num_queued++;
2299 }
2300 }
2301 }
2302 }
2303 /*
2304 * If we have queued params in the open state, send out an ASCONF.
2305 */
2306 if (num_queued > 0) {
2307 sctp_send_asconf(stcb, NULL, SCTP_ADDR_NOT_LOCKED);
2308 }
2309}
2310
2311void
2312sctp_asconf_iterator_end(void *ptr, uint32_t val SCTP_UNUSED)
2313{
2314 struct sctp_asconf_iterator *asc;
2315 struct sctp_ifa *ifa;
2316 struct sctp_laddr *l, *nl;
2317
2318 asc = (struct sctp_asconf_iterator *)ptr;
2319 LIST_FOREACH_SAFE(l, &asc->list_of_work, sctp_nxt_addr, nl) {
2320 ifa = l->ifa;
2321 if (l->action == SCTP_ADD_IP_ADDRESS) {
2322 /* Clear the defer use flag */
2323 ifa->localifa_flags &= ~SCTP_ADDR_DEFER_USE;
2324 }
2325 sctp_free_ifa(ifa);
2326 SCTP_ZONE_FREE(SCTP_BASE_INFO(ipi_zone_laddr), l);
2327 SCTP_DECR_LADDR_COUNT();
2328 }
2329 SCTP_FREE(asc, SCTP_M_ASC_IT);
2330}
2331
2332/*
2333 * sa is the sockaddr to ask the peer to set primary to.
2334 * returns: 0 = completed, -1 = error
2335 */
2336int32_t
2337sctp_set_primary_ip_address_sa(struct sctp_tcb *stcb, struct sockaddr *sa)
2338{
2339 uint32_t vrf_id;
2340 struct sctp_ifa *ifa;
2341
2342 /* find the ifa for the desired set primary */
2343 vrf_id = stcb->asoc.vrf_id;
2344 ifa = sctp_find_ifa_by_addr(sa, vrf_id, SCTP_ADDR_NOT_LOCKED);
2345 if (ifa == NULL) {
2346 /* Invalid address */
2347 return (-1);
2348 }
2349
2350 /* queue an ASCONF:SET_PRIM_ADDR to be sent */
2351 if (!sctp_asconf_queue_add(stcb, ifa, SCTP_SET_PRIM_ADDR)) {
2352 /* set primary queuing succeeded */
2353 SCTPDBG(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1,
2354 "set_primary_ip_address_sa: queued on tcb=%p, ",
2355 (void *)stcb);
2356 SCTPDBG_ADDR(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1, sa);
2357 if ((SCTP_GET_STATE(stcb) == SCTP_STATE_OPEN) ||
2358 (SCTP_GET_STATE(stcb) == SCTP_STATE_SHUTDOWN_RECEIVED)) {
2359#ifdef SCTP_TIMER_BASED_ASCONF
2360 sctp_timer_start(SCTP_TIMER_TYPE_ASCONF,
2361 stcb->sctp_ep, stcb,
2362 stcb->asoc.primary_destination);
2363#else
2364 sctp_send_asconf(stcb, NULL, SCTP_ADDR_NOT_LOCKED);
2365#endif
2366 }
2367 } else {
2368 SCTPDBG(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1, "set_primary_ip_address_sa: failed to add to queue on tcb=%p, ",
2369 (void *)stcb);
2370 SCTPDBG_ADDR(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1, sa);
2371 return (-1);
2372 }
2373 return (0);
2374}
2375
2376int
2377sctp_is_addr_pending(struct sctp_tcb *stcb, struct sctp_ifa *sctp_ifa)
2378{
2379 struct sctp_tmit_chunk *chk, *nchk;
2380 unsigned int offset, asconf_limit;
2381 struct sctp_asconf_chunk *acp;
2382 struct sctp_asconf_paramhdr *aph;
2383 uint8_t aparam_buf[SCTP_PARAM_BUFFER_SIZE];
2384 struct sctp_paramhdr *ph;
2385 int add_cnt, del_cnt;
2386 uint16_t last_param_type;
2387
2388 add_cnt = del_cnt = 0;
2389 last_param_type = 0;
2390 TAILQ_FOREACH_SAFE(chk, &stcb->asoc.asconf_send_queue, sctp_next, nchk) {
2391 if (chk->data == NULL) {
2392 SCTPDBG(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1, "is_addr_pending: No mbuf data?\n");
2393 continue;
2394 }
2395 offset = 0;
2396 acp = mtod(chk->data, struct sctp_asconf_chunk *);
2397 offset += sizeof(struct sctp_asconf_chunk);
2398 asconf_limit = ntohs(acp->ch.chunk_length);
2399 ph = (struct sctp_paramhdr *)sctp_m_getptr(chk->data, offset, sizeof(struct sctp_paramhdr), aparam_buf);
2400 if (ph == NULL) {
2401 SCTPDBG(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1, "is_addr_pending: couldn't get lookup addr!\n");
2402 continue;
2403 }
2404 offset += ntohs(ph->param_length);
2405
2406 aph = (struct sctp_asconf_paramhdr *)sctp_m_getptr(chk->data, offset, sizeof(struct sctp_asconf_paramhdr), aparam_buf);
2407 if (aph == NULL) {
2408 SCTPDBG(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1, "is_addr_pending: Empty ASCONF will be sent?\n");
2409 continue;
2410 }
2411 while (aph != NULL) {
2412 unsigned int param_length, param_type;
2413
2414 param_type = ntohs(aph->ph.param_type);
2415 param_length = ntohs(aph->ph.param_length);
2416 if (offset + param_length > asconf_limit) {
2417 /* parameter goes beyond end of chunk! */
2418 break;
2419 }
2420 if (param_length > sizeof(aparam_buf)) {
2421 SCTPDBG(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1, "is_addr_pending: param length (%u) larger than buffer size!\n", param_length);
2422 break;
2423 }
2424 if (param_length <= sizeof(struct sctp_paramhdr)) {
2425 SCTPDBG(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1, "is_addr_pending: param length(%u) too short\n", param_length);
2426 break;
2427 }
2428
2429 aph = (struct sctp_asconf_paramhdr *)sctp_m_getptr(chk->data, offset, param_length, aparam_buf);
2430 if (aph == NULL) {
2431 SCTPDBG(SCTP_DEBUG_ASCONF1, "is_addr_pending: couldn't get entire param\n");
2432 break;
2433 }
2434
2435 ph = (struct sctp_paramhdr *)(aph + 1);
2436 if (sctp_addr_match(ph, &sctp_ifa->address.sa) != 0) {
2437 switch (param_type) {
2438 case SCTP_ADD_IP_ADDRESS:
2439 add_cnt++;
2440 break;
2441 case SCTP_DEL_IP_ADDRESS:
2442 del_cnt++;
2443 break;
2444 default:
2445 break;
2446 }
2447 last_param_type = param_type;
2448 }
2449
2450 offset += SCTP_SIZE32(param_length);
2451 if (offset >= asconf_limit) {
2452 /* no more data in the mbuf chain */
2453 break;
2454 }
2455 /* get pointer to next asconf param */
2456 aph = (struct sctp_asconf_paramhdr *)sctp_m_getptr(chk->data, offset, sizeof(struct sctp_asconf_paramhdr), aparam_buf);
2457 }
2458 }
2459
2460 /* we want to find the sequences which consist of ADD -> DEL -> ADD or DEL -> ADD */
2461 if (add_cnt > del_cnt ||
2462 (add_cnt == del_cnt && last_param_type == SCTP_ADD_IP_ADDRESS)) {
2463 return (1);
2464 }
2465 return (0);
2466}
2467
2468static struct sockaddr *
2469sctp_find_valid_localaddr(struct sctp_tcb *stcb, int addr_locked)
2470{
2471 struct sctp_vrf *vrf = NULL;
2472 struct sctp_ifn *sctp_ifn;
2473 struct sctp_ifa *sctp_ifa;
2474
2475 if (addr_locked == SCTP_ADDR_NOT_LOCKED)
2476 SCTP_IPI_ADDR_RLOCK();
2477 vrf = sctp_find_vrf(stcb->asoc.vrf_id);
2478 if (vrf == NULL) {
2479 if (addr_locked == SCTP_ADDR_NOT_LOCKED)
2480 SCTP_IPI_ADDR_RUNLOCK();
2481 return (NULL);
2482 }
2483 LIST_FOREACH(sctp_ifn, &vrf->ifnlist, next_ifn) {
2484 if (stcb->asoc.scope.loopback_scope == 0 &&
2485 SCTP_IFN_IS_IFT_LOOP(sctp_ifn)) {
2486 /* Skip if loopback_scope not set */
2487 continue;
2488 }
2489 LIST_FOREACH(sctp_ifa, &sctp_ifn->ifalist, next_ifa) {
2490 switch (sctp_ifa->address.sa.sa_family) {
2491#ifdef INET
2492 case AF_INET:
2493 if (stcb->asoc.scope.ipv4_addr_legal) {
2494 struct sockaddr_in *sin;
2495
2496 sin = &sctp_ifa->address.sin;
2497 if (sin->sin_addr.s_addr == 0) {
2498 /* skip unspecifed addresses */
2499 continue;
2500 }
2501#if defined(__FreeBSD__) && !defined(__Userspace__)
2502 if (prison_check_ip4(stcb->sctp_ep->ip_inp.inp.inp_cred,
2503 &sin->sin_addr) != 0) {
2504 continue;
2505 }
2506#endif
2507 if (stcb->asoc.scope.ipv4_local_scope == 0 &&
2508 IN4_ISPRIVATE_ADDRESS(&sin->sin_addr))
2509 continue;
2510
2511 if (sctp_is_addr_restricted(stcb, sctp_ifa) &&
2512 (!sctp_is_addr_pending(stcb, sctp_ifa)))
2513 continue;
2514 /* found a valid local v4 address to use */
2515 if (addr_locked == SCTP_ADDR_NOT_LOCKED)
2516 SCTP_IPI_ADDR_RUNLOCK();
2517 return (&sctp_ifa->address.sa);
2518 }
2519 break;
2520#endif
2521#ifdef INET6
2522 case AF_INET6:
2523 if (stcb->asoc.scope.ipv6_addr_legal) {
2524 struct sockaddr_in6 *sin6;
2525
2526 if (sctp_ifa->localifa_flags & SCTP_ADDR_IFA_UNUSEABLE) {
2527 continue;
2528 }
2529
2530 sin6 = &sctp_ifa->address.sin6;
2531 if (IN6_IS_ADDR_UNSPECIFIED(&sin6->sin6_addr)) {
2532 /* we skip unspecifed addresses */
2533 continue;
2534 }
2535#if defined(__FreeBSD__) && !defined(__Userspace__)
2536 if (prison_check_ip6(stcb->sctp_ep->ip_inp.inp.inp_cred,
2537 &sin6->sin6_addr) != 0) {
2538 continue;
2539 }
2540#endif
2541 if (stcb->asoc.scope.local_scope == 0 &&
2542 IN6_IS_ADDR_LINKLOCAL(&sin6->sin6_addr))
2543 continue;
2544 if (stcb->asoc.scope.site_scope == 0 &&
2545 IN6_IS_ADDR_SITELOCAL(&sin6->sin6_addr))
2546 continue;
2547
2548 if (sctp_is_addr_restricted(stcb, sctp_ifa) &&
2549 (!sctp_is_addr_pending(stcb, sctp_ifa)))
2550 continue;
2551 /* found a valid local v6 address to use */
2552 if (addr_locked == SCTP_ADDR_NOT_LOCKED)
2553 SCTP_IPI_ADDR_RUNLOCK();
2554 return (&sctp_ifa->address.sa);
2555 }
2556 break;
2557#endif
